Your carrying capacity is halved.

Weak Will

You are highly suggestible and easily duped.
Effect

You take a -3 penalty on Will saves.

Feats

Acquiring Feats

A character chooses a feat at 1st level and at every level divisible by 3. Some classes and races grant additional feats outside of this schedule.

Prerequisites

Some feats have prerequisites. Your character must have the indicated ability score, class feature, feat, skill, base attack bonus, or other quality designated in order to select or use that feat. A character can gain a feat at the same level at which he or she gains the prerequisite.

A character can’t use a feat if he or she has lost a prerequisite.

General Feats

Dodge

Prerequisite

Dexterity 13

Effect

You get a +1 dodge bonus to AC as long as you wear light or no armor.

Toughness

Effect

You gain +3 hp.

Talented

Effect

Select three skills. You get +2 bonuses to all of them.

Pirate

Effect

+2 on all checks related to sailing, boarding ships, firing cannons, finding treasure, climbing or balancing on a ship, bluffing, and resisting intoxication

No penalties for prosthetics (peg legs, hook hands, glass eyes, ect)

You can charge when on a ship no matter the terrain or path (climbing on ropes, jumping down, stairs, rocking ground, etc.)

You gain a parrot, monkey, cat, or dog as an animal companion

Alchemist

Effect

+2 on alchemy checks

+1 on attack rolls with alchemy items.

+2 on saves against poison and fire

Alchemy crafting time and costs reduced by 10%

Explorer

Effect

2 in 6 chance to find secrets doors or compartments

+2 on jump, climb, swim, spot, and survival checks

+5 move speed

+2 on saves against traps

Whip Proficiency

When holding a whip, get +2 on climb checks and checks to swing/hang

Researcher

Effect

+1 on knowledge checks

Can make untrained knowledge checks

Can decipher scripts of any language

+1 language known

While in a library, +4 on knowledge checks and checks to research a specific topic.

Research time and costs reduced by 10% (including spells)

Merchant

Effect

+2 appraise, bluff, and diplomacy

Buy nonmagical items for 5% less

Sell nonmagical items for 5% more

When making a diplomacy check, you may bribe them up to 10gp per level. For each 10gp you give them, you get an additional +1 on the check.

Can make DC 25 appraise checks to identify magic items.

X bonus to owned trade routes

Blacksmith

Effect

+2 to craft weapon and craft armor.

+1 attack with weapons you have crafted yourself. +1 AC with armor you have crafted yourself.

Weapons and Armors you craft are 10% cheaper to craft.

You can craft magical arms and armors by forging them with magical gems you find during your adventures. Each one will have a corresponding craft weapon or craft armor requirement.

These can be used to upgrade existing arms and armor or to make new ones. They can't be used on already enchanted items.

Skill Focus

Effect

Pick a skill you have at least 1 rank in. You gain a +3 bonus to that skill.

Special

You can pick skill focus more than once. Each time, pick a different skill.

Run

Effect

You move 5x your speed when running instead of 4x (or 4x if wearing heavy armor).

Additionally, you suffer no defensive penalties while running.

Leadership

Prerequisite

Level 6

Effect

You are someone others want to follow. This leadership ability and experience that you have acquired allows you to found or take over one of the following:

  • A new domain
  • A new town
  • A class guild

A character can only control/manage one of these. He can turn over the institution to an NPC if he desires, which frees him to pick up a different one.

Additionally, you can recruit a loyal cohort. The cohort is an NPC two levels lower than you. The DM will roll up 3 npcs (or choose from pre-established NPCs), and you can pick one. You can request a broad category of character: Warrior, Rogue, Priest, Mage.

After recruitment, the cohort earns experience at half the rate you do if he does not accompany you on adventures. If he does accompany you on adventures, he gets a half-share of the treasure and earns a proportionate amount of XP (which is effectively half as much as you).

The loyal cohort will not betray you unless mind controlled or cursed or whatever.

You control the cohort during combat and adventures. The DM will roleplay the cohort if necessary (or you can do it, whatever).

Resilient

Effect

Ignore 1 level of fear

Panicked -> Frightened -> Shaken -> Normal

Ignore 1 level of exhaustion. Act as if you are 1 level less exhausted.

Exhausted -> Fatigued -> Normal

Dying from lack of supplies takes 1 additional day.

Special

You cannot take this feat if you have any of the phobia flaws.

Kraken Blessed

Special

Can only be taken at level 1.

Effect

One of your arms is an octopus style tentacle. You can pick up objects as normal, but cannot wield a weapon, wand, shield, etc. in this arm.

You can use this arm to make a slam attack that deals 1d6+str Damage, and can make a free slam attack when you take a standard or full round attack action. If you make the free attack, all your attacks are at -2 for the turn.

You get a +2 on grapple checks, and when you have a creature grappled with your tentacle, you do not count as being in the grapple (thus you can act normally).

Additionally, the Kraken Cult holds you in high regard.

Procrastinator

Effect

You get a -1 to all d20 rolls.

When you are below 50% HP, or when you are blinded, confused, entangled, exhausted, nauseated, sickened, paralyzed, prone, stunned or any other sufficiently severe condtion, the -1 is replaced with a +3 to all d20 rolls. The conditions still apply.

Hero

Prerequisite

Good alignment

Effect

Once per day, when you would be reduced to 0 or fewer HP, you may instead go to 1 HP and remove all negative conditions.

Quick Draw

Effect

You can draw/stow weapons and items as free actions instead of as a move action. Retrieving an item from your backpack is also a free action.

Mage Slayer

Prerequisite

Level 6

Effect

+2 on saves against spells and spell-like abilities

2 in 3 chance to interrupt a spell instead of 1 in 2

If you miss an attack due to a magical miss chance or a mirror image, roll again and take the better result.

When you search, you can easily notice the presence of magic, even if you do not manage to pinpoint its source.

Barbarian Feats

Special Rules

Some barbarian feats are "totem" feats. This is indicated by having totem in the name. A barbarian can only have 3 totem feats.

Fighting Style

This is a placeholder feat. You can take Brute Fighting, Defender Fighting, Dual Wield Fighting, Polearm fighting or Archery, just as the fighter feats. Note that swashbuckling and musketeering are missing.

Combat Tactics

Effect

You gain a +2 bonus when tripping or disarming.

Additionally, if you successfully trip or disarm someone, you are granted an immediate free extra melee attack at the same base attack bonus on the same creature.

At 4th level, the bonus increases to +4.

Combat Brawn

Effect

You gain a +2 bonus when bullrushing, grappling and overrunning.

Additionally, if you succeed on any of these maneuvers, you are granted an immediate free extra melee attack at the same base attack bonus on the same creature. When grappling, you can use this to make a grapple check.

You can force creatures to not move out of the way of your overrun.

At 4th level level, the bonus increase to +4.

Shock Trooper

Prerequisite

Combat Tactics or Combat Brawn, Level 3

Effect

When you hit an enemy with a charge attack, you can make a free bullrush attempt. If you succeed, you can push them in any direction up to 10 feet.

When you bullrush an enemy, if they collide with a solid barrier or another enemy, you get a free trip attempt on the primary target. This does not trigger combat tactics.

When you use your power attack with your charge attack with a penalty of at least -2 attack, you may choose to take a -2 penalty to AC for a +2 bonus to attack.

Eagle Totem

Effect

You can jump in any direction at double movespeed cost without making a jump check.

Spot becomes a class skill and starts with 4 ranks in it.

Special

You may have a maximum of 3 totem feats

Bear Totem

Effect

While raging, your DR is increased by 1 and you get a +1 bonus to AC.

While raging, you get a +4 bonus on grapple checks.

Special

You may have a maximum of 3 totem feats

Lion Totem

Effect

When you make a charge attack while raging, you can make an extra attack at your highest base attack bonus. You must decide this before you make your first attack. If you do, all your attacks suffer a -2 penalty this round.

Special

You may have a maximum of 3 totem feats

Fox Totem

Effect

While raging, your dexterity is increased by 2.

You can use dexterity based skills while raging.

You can make charge attacks while hidden without the enemy having a chance to spot you after you leave cover.

Stealth becomes a class skill and starts with 4 ranks in it.

Special

You may have a maximum of 3 totem feats

Wolf Totem

Effect

If you and an ally threaten the same enemy, you are both considered flanking (+2 on melee attack rolls).

You can buy the Scent skill (usually reserved for animals), Scent becomes a class skill and starts with 4 ranks in it.

Special

You may have a maximum of 3 totem feats

Dragon Totem

Effect

While raging, you have blindsight 30’

When you take this feat, choose a color of dragon -- red (fire), blue (lighting), white (cold), yellow (wind) or brown (earth). The associated damage types for wind and earth are slashing and bludgeoning, respectively.

While raging, your weapon attacks deal 2 bonus damage of the associated type.

This damage bonus increases to 3 at level 6.

Special

You may have a maximum of 3 totem feats

Extra Rage

Effect

You can Rage two additional times per long rest.

Enduring Rage

Effect

When you enter into a rage, you gain temporary HP equal to your level. You lose this temp HP when your rage ends.

While raging, if you would be reduced to below 0 hp, but not to -10 or lower, instead you are reduced to 0 hp and your rage ends.

Additionally, when your rage ends, if the loss of your constitution bonus would reduce your HP below 0 you instead have 0 HP.

Mindless Rage

Effect

The will save bonus from your rage is doubled.

You are immune to fear effects while raging.

If you enter into a rage while suffering from an effect that resulted from a failed will save, you can immediately make a new save. You can enter into a rage even when charmed/paralyzed/etc.

Rage Mage

Effect

Once per rage while raging, you can cast one of the following sorcerer spells as a swift action.

  • Burning Hands
  • Color Spray
  • Jump
  • Magic Missile

At level 5, you can cast two of the above spells per rage.

The caster level for your spells is your level. If a spell has a duration, the spell ends when your rage ends. Your spellcasting attribute for spell DCs is strength. The only component for the spell is verbal.

Bard Feats

Expanded Repertoire

Special

You can take this feat multiple times. Pick a different song each time.

Effect

You know more songs than other bards. Pick one of the below. Additionally, you gain another usage of bardic music every day.

Song of Defense

Standard action to start, must use voice each round to maintain (thus cannot cast bard spells). Maximum of 5 minutes.

You learn an additional way to use your bardic performance. It grants you and your allies +1 AC, +1 saves and DR 1/- while you play + 5 rounds afterwards.

Song of Striding

Standard action to start, must use voice each round to maintain (thus cannot cast bard spells). Maximum of 5 minutes.

You learn an additional way to use your bardic performance. It grants you and your allies a +10 bonus to speed while you play + 5 rounds afterwards.

Song of Conviction

Standard action to start, must use voice each round to maintain (thus cannot cast bard spells). Maximum of 5 minutes.

You learn an additional way to use your bardic performance. It grants you and your allies +2 to saving throws while you play + 5 rounds afterwards.

Song of Dissonance

Standard action to start, must use voice each round to maintain (thus cannot cast bard spells). Maximum of 5 minutes.

You learn an additional way to use your bardic performance. All spellcasters who can hear you have a 20% chance to have their spell wasted.

Jack of all Trades

Effect

When you make a skill check, you can choose to roll as if you had ranks in that skill equal to ½ your bard level (rounded down) + 2 and are treated as if you had that many ranks for things that care about ranks.

Calming Music

Effect

When your group regains hit points from resting, double that healing.

Additionally, as long as any ally is affected by one of your bardic music abilities, when they are the target of a healing effect, they heal one additional HP per level of the effect. (1 HP if effect does not have a level)

Force of Personality

Effect

Make bluff checks instead of will saves.

Dashing Rogue

Effect

Learn two thief skills. They start with 2 ranks each.

Swift Song

Effect

Start using bardic music as a swift action.

Skilled

Effect

Pick one skill. That skill gets a +3 bonus.

Additionally, you gain 2 skill points which you can spend immediately.

Multi Talented

Effect

Pick three Perform skills. They all count as having ranks equal to the highest ranks amongst them.

You gain 3 extra uses of bardic music per long rest.

Battledancer

Effect

You can use Perform(Dance) in place of tumble. You get a +2 dodge bonus to AC during your bardic performances.

Negotiator

Effect

You can use Perform(Oration) in place of bluff and diplomacy. You can make a perform (Oration) check to break charms and mind control (DC = save DC).

Musician’s Ears

Effect

+4 bonus to listen

+10 bonus on listen checks to pinpoint an invisible creature.

Cleric Feats

Special Rules

Some cleric feats are marked as being a "purpose" feat. A cleric can only have one purpose feat and must take it at level 1.

Extra Turning

Effect

You can turn the undead 4 more times per long rest.

Special

You can take this feat more than once. Its effects stack.

Archivist

Purpose
Effect

You gain a +1 bonus on knowledge checks.

You can spend a use of turn undead as a standard action to gain insight into a creature you are fighting. You must be able to directly see the creature to do this. Pick one of the below from the table. You must have at least 4 ranks in the corresponding knowledge skill. You learn qualitative, not quantitative information (the monster has a poison attack that hurts constitution, but you don't know the save DC or amount of damage).

Creature Insights
Category Result
Defenses Any damage immunities, resistances or reductions.
Whether the creature has spell resistance.
What damage type overcomes their damage reduction.
Offenses Special attacks, general attack forms, whether it is a magic-user.
Knowledge Requirements
Skill Creatures
Arcana Dragons, Magical creatures
Architecture and Engineering Constructs (like golems, animated statues)
Dungeoneering Oozes, Slimes
History Demihumans, giants
Nature Animals, plants, vermin
Religion Undead, demons, devils, angels
The Planes Elementals, other outsiders
Special

You can only take one purpose feat.

Undead Hunter

Purpose
Effect

Gain 1 additional use of turn undead. You turn as if you were 1 level higher.

Once per turn when you hit an undead creature, a demon, devil or evil priest with a weapon attack, you can spend one use of turn undead to deal an additional 1d6 sacred damage. This damage increases by 1d6 at each odd level. (2d6 at 3, 3d6 at 5, etc.)

Special

You can only take one purpose feat.

Preacher

Purpose
Effect

You gain a +1 bonus on charisma based skill checks

Bluff and Gather Information are now class skills, and start with 4 ranks in each.

Your followers, hirelings and mercenaries are 1 point more loyal.

You can spend uses of turn undead to heal allies. As a standard action, you can touch a creature and heal them for 1d8+wisdom modifier HP. This healing increases by 1d8 at each odd level. (2d8 at 3, 3d8 at 5, etc.)

Special

You can only take one purpose feat.

Quicken Turning

Effect

You can expend two uses of turn undead instead of one in order to turn as a swift action. You can only turn undead once per turn.

This also benefits the weird turnings from cleric domains, like plant domain.

Augment Healing

Effect

Increase healing of your spells by +2 per spell level

Increase Pain

Prerequisite

Evil alignment

Effect

Increase the damage of your inflict wounds spells by +2 per spell level

Extra Domain

Effect

Gain one additional domain (both its power and its spells).

Godly Luck

Effect

You gain two luck points.

If you roll a 1 on a turning attempt, reroll it.

You can spend a luck point to reroll turn undead attempts.

Special

If you are a cleric/thief, these luck points are the same as the points of the thief luck feats.

Shield Focus

Effect

Your shield bonus improves by +1 when using a shield.

Druid Feats

Entangling Spell

+1 Metamagic
Effect

Can only be used with spells that have an area, deal damage, and have a saving throw. Any creatures that fail their saves against the spell are also entangled for 1d4 rounds.

Sudden Entangling Spell

2/long rest suddenly add entangling spell to a spell.

Wildfire Druid

Effect

Add these spells to your druid spell list. You can cast them spontaneously, in the same way you can wild shape spontaneously.

Additionally, you gain fire resist 5

  • Ray of Fire (level 0, 1d3 fire on touch attack)
  • Burning Hands
  • Scorching Ray
  • Fireball
  • Wall of Fire

Storm Druid

Effect

Add these spells to your druid spell list. You can cast them spontaneously, in the same way you can wild shape spontaneously. Additionally, you gain electric resist 5

  • Electric Jolt
  • Jumping Bolt (Two targets within 30’, 1d4 per caster level, reflex for half)
  • Lightning Strike (5’ radius, 3d6 + 1d6 per 2 levels above 3, reflex for half)
  • Lightning Bolt
  • Lightning Fog

Wildshape Specialization

Effect

You can speak while wildshaped. This does not allow you to cast spells with verbal components.

Additionally, when you cast a wildshape spell, you gain temp HP equal to the level of the spell.

Normal

You can't speak while wildshaped.

Wildshape Fighting Focus

Effect

You get a +1 bonus to attacks while wildshaped.

Ferocious Wildshape

Prerequisite

Wildshape Specialization

Effect

When you take the charge action while shapeshifted, you get an additional attack at your highest BAB, but all your attacks suffer a -2 attack penalty.

Beast Senses

Prerequisite

Wildshape Specialization

Effect

Even when not transformed, you can make scent checks.

You get a +2 bonus to spot, listen, and scent.

Bestial Fury

Prerequisite

Wildshape Specialization

Effect

Once per long rest while shapeshifted, you can rage like a barbarian. The rage ends early if you transform back into a person.

Extra Wildshaping

Prerequisite

Wildshape Specialization

Effect

You gain an extra spell slot of the highest level you normally have access to which can only be used to cast a wildshape spell.

Animal Speech

Effect

You can cast Speak with Animals as a spell like ability at will.

If you speak with an animal and learn a bit of its concerns and interests, you get a +4 bonus to any diplomacy/wild empathy checks on that animal.

Animal Mind

Effect

+1 to will saves

As an immediate action when you fail a will save, you may cast a wildshape spell. If you do, you save against the effect instead. However, you must spend your next turn with the brain of the animal you turned into. A bear might attack things it thinks are enemies, but an owl will probably fly away.

Warden

Effect

+1 to attack and damage with weapon attacks. This includes spell weapons like Flame Blade, but not natural weapons. This effect is doubled for spell weapons like Flame Blade.

You gain +3 HP.

Fighter Feats

Special Rules

Some fighter feats are "maneuvers". Maneuvers can be used once per battle. When you choose a maneuver feat, you can also pick another maneuver feat for free (BOGO). Only 1 maneuver may be applied to a single attack.

Brute Fighting

You are better at fighting with brute force.

Effect

For the following effects, the brute weapons are:

  • Falchion
  • Greatsword
  • Greataxe
  • Greatclub
  • Greathammer

Brute fighting gives you several benefits, which improve as you level up

Brute Weapon Focus

At 1st level, you get a +1 bonus to attacks with brute weapons.

Power Attack

At 1st level, on your turn before you make any attacks, you can choose to willingly inflict a penalty to your attacks up to your BAB. If you do, you add twice that much to your damage rolls with brute weapons this turn. This penalty on attacks and bonus on damage apply until your next turn.

You can only subtract up to 5, or your BAB, whichever is lower.

Brute Weapon Specialization

At 2nd level, you get +2 damage with brute weapons

Greater Brute Weapon Focus

At 4th level, you get an additional +1 to attacks with brute weapons (for a total of +2).

Greater Brute Weapon Specialization

At 6th level, you get an additional +2 to damage with brute weapons (for a total of +4).

Defender Fighting

You are better at fighting with shield and sword (or axe, whatever).

Effect

You gain the benefits of defender fighting as long as you have a one-handed melee weapon in one hand and a shield in the other. If you drop or are disarmed of one or the other or otherwise don't have one in your hands, you lose the benefits.

This is referred to as "defender fighting" below.

Defender Focus

At 1st level, you get a +1 bonus to attacks and a +1 bonus to AC while defender fighting.

While defender fighting, you add double your strength bonus to your damage rolls instead of just your strength bonus.

Combat Expertise

At 1st level, on your turn before you make any attacks, you can choose to willingly inflict a penalty to your attacks up to your BAB. If you do, you add that much to your AC until your next turn. You must attack this turn to receive this benefit.

You lose this benefit if you stop defender fighting.

Defender Fighting Specialization

At 2nd level, you get +2 damage when defender fighting.

Greater Defender Fighting Focus

At 4th level, you get an additional +1 to attacks when defender fighting.

Greater Defender Fighting Specialization

At 6th level, you get an additional +2 to damage when defender fighting.

Dual Wield Fighting

You are better at fighting with two weapons, like a frigging ninja.

Effect

You gain the benefits of Dual Wield Fighting as long as you have two light melee weapons in your hands. If you ever stop having two in your hands, you lose the benefits. Having a light weapon in each hand is referred to as "dual wielding" below.

Two Weapon Fighting

At 1st level, when you attack with your main hand weapon, you get an extra free attack with your off hand weapon this round. You benefit from this when dual wielding and once per round.

When you draw or sheath a light weapon, you can instead do so for both of your weapons.

Additionally, you get a +1 shield bonus to AC when fighting with two weapons.

Two Weapon Focus

At 1st level, you get a +1 bonus to attacks with dual wielding.

Two Weapon Specialization

At 2nd level, you get +2 damage when dual wielding.

Greater Two Weapon Focus

At 4th level, you get an additional +1 to attacks when dual wielding.

Greater Two Weapon Specialization

At 6th level, you get an additional +2 to damage when dual wielding.

Pirate Fighting

You are better at fighting like a pirate.

Effect

You gain the benefits of pirate fighting when you:

  • Fight with a pistol in each hand
  • Fight with a Dagger, Cutlass, Rapier, Harpoon, or Longsword in one hand and a pistol in the other
  • Fight with just a Dagger, Cutlass, Rapier, Harpoon or Longsword in one hand and the other hand is empty.

This is referred to as pirate fighting below.

Additionally, you get a +2 bonus to flirting.

You also gain harpoon proficiency.

Pirate Fighting Focus

At 1st level, you get +1 to attacks while pirate fighting.

Pirate Fighting Defense

At 1st level, while you only have a Dagger, Cutlass, Rapier, Harpoon or Longsword in one hand, you get a +2 shield bonus to AC.

Swift Reload

At 1st level, you can reload your pistol as half of a move action while pirate fighting. What this means is you can either reload two pistols as one move action or reload one pistol and then move half your speed.

Daring-do

At 1st level, if you attack with a Dagger, Cutlass, Rapier, Harpoon or Longsword, you can fire your pistol as a free action this round without provoking attacks of opportunity.

Additionally, if you have a pistol in each hand, you can fire one and then fire the other one for free. This still provokes attacks of opportunities for ranged attacks as normal.

Pirate Fighting Specialization

At 2nd level, you get +2 damage while pirate fighting.

Greater Pirate Fighting Focus

At 4th level, you get an additional +1 to attacks while pirate fighting.

Greater Pirate Fighting Specialization

At 6th level, you get an additional +2 to damage while pirate fighting.

Musketeering

You are better at fighting with musket, bayonet and blunderbuss.

Effect

You gain the benefits of musketeering when you:

  • Fight with a musket as a ranged weapon
  • Fight with a bayonet attached to a musket as a melee weapon
  • Fight with a blunderbuss.

This is referred to as "musketeering" below.

Musketeering Focus

At 1st level, you get +1 to attacks while musketeering.

Swift Reload

At 1st level, you can reload your musket or blunderbuss as a move action.

Sharpshooter

At 1st level, you add your dexterity bonus to damage with your musket.

Blunderblaster

At 1st level, you can target an additional creature when you attack with the blunderbuss.

Bayonetter

At 1st level, you can use the bayonet on your musket as a reach weapon with 10' of reach and no deadzone.

Musketeering Specialization

At 2nd level, you get +2 damage while musketeering.

Greater Musketeering Focus

At 4th level, you get an additional +1 to attacks while musketeering.

Greater Musketeering Specialization

At 6th level, you get an additional +2 to damage while musketeering.

Archery

You are better at fighting with the bow.

Note: archery fighting is weaker than the other ones.

Effect

Archery is fighting with a shortbow or longbow.

Archery Focus

At 1st level, you get +1 to attacks with archery.

Archery Specialization

At 2nd level, you get +2 damage with archery.

Greater Archery Focus

At 4th level, you get an additional +1 to attacks with archery.

Greater Archery Specialization

At 6th level, you get an additional +2 to damage with archery.

Polearm Fighting

You're best when wielding a long pole.

Note: polearm fighting is weaker than the other ones.

Effect

The following are polearms:

  • Glaive
  • Halberd
  • Longspear
  • Shortspear
  • Spear
  • Trident
Polearm Focus

At 1st level, you get +1 to attacks with polearms.

Polearm Specialization

At 2nd level, you get +2 damage with polearms.

Greater Polearm Focus

At 4th level, you get an additional +1 to attacks with polearms.

Greater Polearm Specialization

At 6th level, you get an additional +2 to damage with polearms.

Sweeping Blow

Maneuver
Sweeping Blow
This melee attack attacks two adjacent creatures within your reach (only roll one attack).

Brazen Attack

Maneuver
Brazen Attack
This melee attack gets a +4 bonus, but you suffer -4 to your AC until beginning of the next turn.

Focused Attack

Maneuver
Focused Attack
Roll two attack rolls for this attack. You may pick which roll to use. If you use the lower roll, your attack deals an extra 1d6 damage.

Blocking Attack

Maneuver
Blocking Attack
If you hit with this melee attack, that creature can only take opportunity attacks against you this turn.

Clever Positioning

Maneuver
Clever Positioning
If you hit with this melee attack, you and the creature swap positions. Neither of you need to spend movement.

Overwhelming Attack

Maneuver
Overwhelming Attack
If you hit with this melee attack, the creature loses their move action on their next turn.

Leap Attack

Maneuver
Leap Attack
For this melee attack, you can use your ranks in jump instead of your base attack bonus. For every 5 points you exceed their AC, you deal an extra 1d6 damage. Any miscellaneous bonuses to jump you have (such as Halfling athleticism) applies to this attack.

Distracting Attack

Maneuver
Distracting Attack
If you hit with this melee attack, your allies get a +2 bonus against that enemy. This enables sneak attack.

Stonecold Attack

Maneuver
Stonecold Attack
If you hit with this melee attack, you gain DR 5/- (all sources of damage deal 5 less to you) until your next turn.

Impairing Attack

Maneuver
Impairing Attack
If you hit with this melee attack, the victim suffers -4 to their attacks until your next turn.

Dedicated Attack

Maneuver
Dedicated Attack
Use this after you miss. You can reroll.

Critical Attack

Maneuver
Critical Attack
If you hit with this attack, you deal double damage.

Cleave

Maneuver
Cleave
Use this after you drop a creature with a melee attack. Take an immediate, extra, free, melee attack aginst another creature within your reach. The extra attack is with the same weapon and at the same bonus as the attack that dropped the previous creature. If it is your turn, you can 5' step before making the extra attack if you haven't already moved this round. You can keep using this maneuver until you stop dropping people.

Deadly Attack

Maneuver
Deadly Attack
If you hit with this attack, you deal an extra 1d6 damage.

Riposte

Maneuver
Riposte
When an enemy misses you with an attack, you can use this maneuver to take an attack of opportunity against them.

Combat Tactics

Effect

You gain a +2 bonus when tripping or disarming.

Additionally, if you successfully trip or disarm someone, you are granted an immediate free extra melee attack at the same base attack bonus on the same creature.

At 4th level, the bonus increases to +4.

Combat Brawn

Effect

You gain a +2 bonus when bullrushing, grappling and overrunning.

Additionally, if you succeed on any of these maneuvers, you are granted an immediate free extra melee attack at the same base attack bonus on the same creature. When grappling, you can use this to make a grapple check.

You can force creatures to not move out of the way of your overrun.

At 4th level level, the bonus increase to +4.

Combat Reflexes

Effect

You may make up to three attacks of opportunity each round.

Normal

You can normally only make up to one attack of opportunity each round.

Weapon Finesse

Effect

You can use dexterity for attack rolls instead of strength, for anything.

Provoker

Effect

Once per enemy, when you hit them with a melee attack, you may make a DC 15 bluff check. If you succeed, that enemy must target you next round. If they make multiple attacks, they must continue targeting you until they hit you once. If they use an ability with an area, you must be inside the area. If they use a single target ability, they must target you.

You gain +3 HP

Spring Attack

Prerequisite

Dexterity 13

Effect

If you move, attack, and then move again, you do not provoke attacks of opportunity from the target of your attack(s). Intent is all that matters here (you might fall in a pit and be unable to attack).

Whirlwind Attack

Prerequisite

Level 4

Effect

When you use attack action, you can give up your regular attacks and instead make one melee attack at your full base attack bonus against each opponent within reach.

When you use the Whirlwind Attack feat, you also forfeit any bonus or extra attacks granted by other feats, spells, or abilities, with the exception of cleave.

Blind-Fight

Effect

In melee, every time you miss because of concealment, you can reroll your miss chance percentile roll one time to see if you actually hit.

An invisible attacker gets no advantages related to hitting you in melee. The invisible attacker’s bonuses do still apply for ranged attacks, however.

You take only half the usual penalty to speed for being unable to see. Darkness and poor visibility in general reduces your speed to three-quarters normal, instead of one-half.

Exotic Weapon Proficiency

Effect

You become proficient will all exotic weapons.

Improved Feint

Effect

You can feint as a move action instead of as a standard action. If you succeed, the feint bonus is +4 instead of +2.

Champion

Effect

You have a 25%+5% chance per fighter level to bend bars/lift gates.

You can add your fighter level to jump, swim, climb checks.

Monk Feats

Special Rules

Some monk feats are a school feat. You can only have 1 school feat.

School of Elemental Bending

Prerequisite

Stunning Fist

Effect

You gain 1 additional stunt point. Each of the following abilities costs 1 point to activate.

Flaming Fist
Swift action, 1 round duration. Your attacks deal 1d4 extra fire damage.
Speed of Wind
Swift action, 1 round duration. Your movespeed doubles. +10 on jump checks. Walk on water and up walls.
Stone Barrier

Swift action, 1 minute duration, range 5’.

Summon a 5x5x5 cube of stone in an unoccupied space on a floor.

Water Whip

Swift Action, range 15’, make a ranged touch attack against a creature or object.

If you hit, you can pull yourself to them. If the target is a creature of your size or smaller, you can pull them to you instead. If the target is an object of size small or smaller, you can pull it to you instead.

Intermediate Bending

Prerequisite

Level 3, School of Elemental Bending

Effect

Pick one of the following abilities. You can use it twice per day without spending stunt points.

Greater Flaming Fist

Swift action

Each of your attacks deal 1d6 additional damage this turn. Does not stack with Flaming Fist.

Wind Walker
Swift action, 1 hour. you can float above the ground while moving as you normally do. You ignore difficult terrain, can float above water and lava, don’t trigger weight based traps, leave no footprints, and you are immune to fall damage. Additionally, you get a +5 on jump checks.
Greater Stone Barrier
Swift action, 10 min, range 30’. Summon up to 8 5x5x5 stone cubes. You can stack them. If you place one into the space of a medium or smaller creature, they must make a reflex save (DC 11+Wis mod + (level-1/2)) or take 1d6+level damage and they are pushed to the nearest open space. If they succeed, they take no damage and the cube is pushed to the nearest open space. The cubes are summoned simultaneously so you cannot chain summon them on a single target.
Greater Water Whip
Swift action As water whip, but the range is extended to 20’, you can pull large creatures 5’, you can choose to have the whip deal 1d6+level damage, and it does not require any kind of attack roll when you target an object or surface.

Advanced Bending

Prerequisite

School of Elemental Bending, Level 6

Effect

You can cast each of these spells as a SLA as swift actions once per long rest.

  • Burning Hands
  • Gust of Wind
  • Fist of Stone
  • Wave Blessing

School of the Iron Fist

Effect

If you hit a target with multiple attacks in a single turn, only apply hardness and damage reduction once.

+1 damage with melee attacks

You can use each of these maneuvers once per encounter. Can only apply 1 to a single attack.

Critical Attack
If you hit with this attack, you deal double damage.
Stonecold Attack
If you hit with this melee attack, you gain DR 5/- (all sources of damage deal 5 less to you) until yyour next turn.

Intermediate Iron Fist

Prerequisite

Level 3, School of Iron Fist

Effect

Pick one additional Maneuver

+1 damage with melee attacks

Iron Fist Master

Prerequisite

School of Iron Fist, Level 6

Effect
+1 damage with melee attacks Pick two additional maneuvers from the fighter feat list.

School of Drunken Fist

Effect

You suffer no penalties from inebriation, but only benefit from this feat while intoxicated. You must dedicate 2 slots of inventory space to alcohol (1 for small creatures), but do not need to track exactly how much alcohol you have in each bottle.

+1 bonus to reflex and fortitude saves

+1 dodge bonus to AC

+1 attack on melee attacks

Any time you would be knocked prone, make a DC 15 reflex save. If you succeed, you are not knocked prone.

Intermediate Drunken Fist

Prerequisite

Level 3, Drunken Fist

Effect

Once per encounter as a standard action, spray and ignite alcohol in a 15’ cone. Deals 1d4 damage per level, reflex save (DC 11+Wis mod + (level-1/2)) for half damage. At level 5, it can be made into a 20’ cone.

Additionally, once per day, you can autosucced a will save that you have failed, but you become sober and do not benefit from any Drunken Fist feats until you have had the chance to booze up again.

Drunken Master

Prerequisite

School of Drunken Fist, Level 6

Effect

Must be drunk

+1 bonus to reflex and fortitude saves

+1 dodge bonus to AC

+1 attack on melee attacks

Immediate action, move 5’ without provoking AoO

School Of Ninjutsu

Effect

You become proficient with short swords and they are monk weapons.

You gain 1 additional stunt point. Each of the following abilities costs 1 point to activate.

Transformation

Standard action, 8 hours

Take on the appearance of any medium sized humanoid.

Substitution

Immediate action

When struck with an attack, move 5 ft and the attack misses instead.

Exploding Talisman

Free action

The next weapon you throw this turn deals an additional d6 fire damage.

Ninja Stealth

Swift action, 1 hour

Hide in shadows as a thief.

Ninja Mobility

Swift Action, 1 minute.

Can walk on water and run on walls.

Intermediate Ninjutsu

Prerequisite

Level 3, School of Ninjutsu

Effect

Your transformation ability lets you be small or medium sized.

Ninja Mobility lasts until you long rest.

You gain flanking and hide in shadows as a rogue.

Ninja Bloodline

Prerequisite

School Of Ninjutsu, Level 6

Effect

Pick one special jutsu. It can be used twice per long rest and does not require stunning fist uses..

Shadow Clone

Swift action: Lasts 1 minute

Create 3 clones of yourself. When an enemy attacks you, they have a chance of attacking a clone instead. You and each clone have an equal chance of being targeted. These clones are not illusions. Clones have 10 AC and 1 HP.

Toad Summon

Standard Action: Lasts 1 minute,

Summon a large toad in an open space within 30 ft. It follows your commands as best it can. It has a bite attack and can swallow medium-sized enemies.

Eyes of the Mirror God

Immediate action when a creature you can see performs some jutsu, spell, or special attack like a dragon breath.

Until the end of your next turn, you can perform the same action you saw with new targets. Uses same action type as original but doesn’t require any resources (spell slots, ki, etc).

School of Gun-Do

Effect

+1 attack with guns

Guns are monk weapons for you.

Reloading a pistol is a move action

Firing guns does not provoke attacks of opportunity

Firing a gun can be used as a flurry of blows attack.

Firing at point blank range does not impose a penalty for firing into a melee.

Meleeing with a gun deals base damage as your unarmed attack, but also benefits from the gun’s magical properties.

Intermediate Gun-Do

Prerequisite

Level 3, School of Gun-Do

Effect

When you deflect a bullet, you can use it to reload as a free action.

When you can fire your gun as an AoO.

Your guns benefit from your Ki bonus (that you get at level 4).

Gun-Do Master

Prerequisite

School of Gun-Do, Level 6

Effect

+1 damage with guns

Reloading your pistol is a free action when you fire at a target within melee range.

Once per turn after you flurry of blows, you can fire a gun at a target you did not attack yet this turn.

Open Chakra

Effect

Gain an ability from either school of ninjutsu or school of elemental bending.

Spring Attack

Prerequisite

Dexterity 13

Effect

If you move, attack, and then move again, you do not provoke attacks of opportunity from the target of your attack(s). Intent is all that matters here (you might fall in a pit and be unable to attack).

Blind-Fight

Effect

In melee, every time you miss because of concealment, you can reroll your miss chance percentile roll one time to see if you actually hit.

An invisible attacker gets no advantages related to hitting you in melee. The invisible attacker’s bonuses do still apply for ranged attacks, however.

You take only half the usual penalty to speed for being unable to see. Darkness and poor visibility in general reduces your speed to three-quarters normal, instead of one-half.

Quick Draw

Effect

You can draw/stow weapons as free actions instead of as a move action.

Combat Reflexes

Effect

You may make up to three attacks of opportunity each round.

Normal

You can normally only make up to one attack of opportunity each round.

Combat Tactics

Effect

You gain a +2 bonus when tripping or disarming.

Additionally, if you successfully trip or disarm someone, you are granted an immediate free extra melee attack at the same base attack bonus on the same creature.

At 4th level, the bonus increases to +4.

Combat Brawn

Effect

You gain a +2 bonus when bullrushing, grappling and overrunning.

Additionally, if you succeed on any of these maneuvers, you are granted an immediate free extra melee attack at the same base attack bonus on the same creature. When grappling, you can use this to make a grapple check.

You can force creatures to not move out of the way of your overrun.

At 4th level level, the bonus increase to +4.

Still Breath

Prerequisite

Level 6

Effect

You don’t need to breath. You cannot suffocate or drown, and are immune to inhaled poisons.

You must still breath to speak.

Fancy Footwork

Effect

+5' movespeed

You can 5' step twice per turn.

+2 to defend against trip, disarm, grapple, overrun, bullrush

Ranger Feats

Fighting Style

This is a placeholder feat. You can take Brute Fighting, Defender Fighting, Dual Wield Fighting, Pirate Fighting, Musketeering, Polearm fighting or Archery, just as the fighter feats. Note that level 1 rangers and level 6 rangers can get Dual Wield Fighting, Pirate Fighting or Musketeering for free.

Combat Tactics

Effect

You gain a +2 bonus when tripping or disarming.

Additionally, if you successfully trip or disarm someone, you are granted an immediate free extra melee attack at the same base attack bonus on the same creature.

At 4th level, the bonus increases to +4.

Combat Brawn

Effect

You gain a +2 bonus when bullrushing, grappling and overrunning.

Additionally, if you succeed on any of these maneuvers, you are granted an immediate free extra melee attack at the same base attack bonus on the same creature. When grappling, you can use this to make a grapple check.

You can force creatures to not move out of the way of your overrun.

At 4th level level, the bonus increase to +4.

Spring Attack

Prerequisite

Dexterity 13

Effect

If you move, attack, and then move again, you do not provoke attacks of opportunity from the target of your attack(s). Intent is all that matters here (you might fall in a pit and be unable to attack).

Manyshot

Prerequisite

Level 6

Effect

With a single ranged attack, you can attack two creatures who are next to each other.

Special

Level 6 rangers get this for free if they are in light or no armor.

Tracker

Effect

+4 on tracking checks. Move at full speed when tracking. If you succeed on a check, you know exactly how many people you are tracking, what their sizes are, and what their types are (as per the favored enemy list).

Improved Animal Companion

Effect

Your companion gets +1 attack and AC and +3 HP. Additionally, you count as being 1 level higher when determining what animal companion you can have.

Magic Hunter

Effect

Add spellcasters as a favored enemy. You get +2 on saves against spells.

Ranger School

Special

Must be taken at level 1

Effect

All non-thief skills are class skills. You get 4 additional skill points at level 1, and 1 additional point at each new level.

Improved Hide

Effect

Creatures with the scent skill roll against your hide check instead of a fixed DC.

Creatures with blindsight need to roll against your hide check as well.

Ambusher

Effect

If you would get a surprise round, you roll a 20 on your initiative check.

Your party gets +2 to initiative. If multiple party members have this feat, this benefit does not stack.

+1 on stealth checks

Extra Favored Enemy

Effect

Pick one additional favored enemy type. It has the bonuses of your highest favored enemy.

Improved Favored Enemy

Effect

All favored enemy bonuses increased by 2.

Flexible Misanthropy

Effect

All PC races are included with the Elves favored enemy.

Natural Magic

Effect

Gain one level one spell per long rest. Prepare from the druid list. You get an additional spell per long rest at levels 4 and 7.

Shot on the run

Effect

You can move, then make a ranged attack, then move again so long as you don’t double back.

Ranged Pin

Effect

Once per encounter per enemy you can declare an attack a ranged pin attack. If it hits, the target must make a DC 11+Dex Mod+(level/2) reflex save or be unable to move on its next turn. The creature gets a +4 on the save for each size category above medium.

Arrow Volley

Prerequisite

Manyshot

Effect

Full round action. Make attacks against all creatures in a 15’ square.

Terrain Master

Effect

Gain one additional favored terrain. Improve terrain bonuses by 2.

Trophy Collector

Effect

Once your party has slain a creature in combat, you can take a trophy from the corpse. If you do, you get +1 attack and saves when fighting that creature type. For example, your party kills their first goblin, and you take a goblin tooth and put it on your necklace. From now on, you get +1 attack on goblins, and +1 on saves from goblin effects.

At level 5, this bonus increases to +2.

Sorcerer Feats

Special Rules

Some sorcerer feats are marked as being an "origin" feat. A sorcerer can only have one origin feat and can only take this feat at level 1.

Some sorcerer feats are marked as being a metamagic feat. A metamagic feat is a feat that modifies a spell.

A feat modified by metamagic usually requires expending a slot of a higher level than normal for the spell. However, the spell is not higher level for the effects that care about the spell's level.

Only one metamagic can be applied to a single casting of a spell.

Chaos Magic

Origin Feat
Prerequisite

Can take only at level 1, can only have 1 origin feat

This is an origin feat.

Effect

Whenever you cast a spell of level 1 or higher, there is a 30% chance for a chaos effect. The DM rolls on a secret table for your chaos effect.

All your spells known are randomly determined instead of you choosing. Whenever you level up, randomly determine all spells known instead of you choosing. You know one additional spell per spell level.

Whenever you level up, reroll all hit dice beyond the 1st. You take the new total, even if it is lower.

Whenever you deal or receive damage, roll 1d6-1d6. Add that amount to the damage (negative results reduce damage, but not below 0).

You gain +3 HP and a +1 to all saves.

Blood Magic

Origin feat
Prerequisite

Can take only at level 1, can only have 1 origin feat

This is an origin feat.

Effect

When you cast a spell modified by a metamagic feat, you can sacrifice HP to mitigate the level adjustment of the metamagic.

For each 1d4 HP you sacrifice, you can mitigate the level adjustment by 1.

When you are below half your maximum hit points, you gain fast healing 1 until you are above half your maximum hit points.

Dragon Magic

Origin feat
Prerequisite

Can take only at level 1, can only have 1 origin feat

This is an origin feat.

Effect

Choose a color of dragon -- red (fire), blue (lighting), white (cold), yellow (wind) or brown (earth). The associated damage types for wind and earth are slashing and bludgeoning, respectively.

All spells you cast that deal damage have their damage type changed to the associated type. You gain resistance 5 to that damage type, and spells you cast that would normally deal damage of that type have their DCs increased by 1 and a +1 bonus to any attack rolls. You also ignore 5 points of the target's resistance of that damage type.

Additionally, you gain dragon scales. These scales don't count as armor (so you can still cast in them) but they give you a +3 armor bonus to AC.

Ray Magic

Origin Feat
Prerequisite

Can take only at level 1, can only have 1 origin feat

Effect

You suffer from a strange condition where all of your spells are rays.

This has no effect on spells that are already rays.

For some spells this is benign (turning mage armor into a ray means you can shoot it at yourself or an ally), but for other spells it has weird effects.

Spells that allow a save are 50% more powerful, but you also have to hit them with a ranged touch attack. They still get a save for half damage or whatever if that is allowed.

Ask your DM how other spells work. In general, a ranged touch attack is also now required.

Dragon Breath

Prerequisite

Dragon Magic, level 3

Effect

You learn a new spell called Dragon Breath.

Dragon Breath
Level: Sorcerer 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Area: 30' cone
Saving Throw: Reflex half

You breath out a 30' cone of damage based on your chosen type. Those in the cone suffer 1d6 damage per sorcerer level.

Extend Spell

Metamagic
Effect

Double the duration of the spell.

Level adjustment +1

Enlarge Spell

Metamagic
Effect

Increase the dimensions of the area of the spell by 50%.

Level adjustment +1

Reach Spell

Metamagic
Effect

Increase the range category of a spell.

Touch -> Short

Short -> Medium

Medium ->Long

Level adjustment +1

Ghost Touch Spell

Metamagic
Effect

Your spell always fully affects incorporeal/ethereal creatures, but corporeal creatures now have a 50% chance to not be affected.

Level Adjustment +0

Mental Spell

Metamagic
Effect

Cast a spell without needing to supply verbal, somatic, or low cost material components.

Level Adjustment +1

Flash Frost Spell

Metamagic
Effect

When you cast a spell that has an area and deals cold damage, the area of the spell is also covered in slippery ice for 1 round. Creatures that attempt to move in the ice must make reflex saves or fall prone.

Additionally, the spell’s damage is increased by +2 per spell level.

Level Adjustment +1

Scorching Spell

Metamagic
Effect

When you cast a spell that deals fire damage, any creatures that fails their save or is hit by an attack roll are now on fire. They will take an additional d6*spell level damage at the start of their next turn.

Level Adjustment +1

Shocking Spell

Metamagic
Effect

When you cast a spell that deals lightning damage, creatures wearing or holding metal get -2 on their save/ac. Any creatures that fail their save or are hit by an attack roll are unable to make attacks of opportunity for 1 round.

Additionally, the spell’s damage is increased by +3 per spell level.

Level Adjustment +1

Sculpt

Metamagic
Effect

You can change the area of a spell that has an area to be one of the following: 120-foot tube, 20-foot radius sphere, 60-foot cone, two 10-foot cube.

If the area of the spell is originally 2-dimensional, instead use line, circle, triangle, and square.

Level Adjustment +1

Empower Spell

Metamagic
Effect

Damage and healing of spell increased by 50%.

Level adjustment +2

Split Ray

Metamagic
Effect

Adds 1 ray to a ray spell, must be aimed at targets within 30ft. of each other.

Level adjustment +2

Twin Cast

Metamagic
Effect

Can only be used on spells that can only affect a single target. You cast the spell a second time on a different target.

Level adjustment +2

Repeated Spell

Metamagic
Effect

Cast the spell twice. Can have different targets/areas.

Level adjustment +3

Quick Cast

Metamagic
Effect

Cast spell as swift action.

Level Adjustment +3

Metamagic Mastery

Metamagic
Prerequisite

Any 3 other metamagic feats

Effect

You gain a pool of 6 metamagic points per long rest.

You can use these points to offset the level adjustment of a metamagic feat you apply to a spell. This does not reduce the level of the spell below its original level.

For example, you could use 3 of these points to quicken a spell and cast it at its original level.

Elemental Mastery

Special

You can take this feat twice. The second time, you learn the other two.

Effect

Pick two of Fiery Burst, Icy Breath, Chain Shock and Acidic Splatter. You learn those.

Fiery Burst
Effect

You learn a special spell called fiery burst for which you do not need to expend spell slots to cast. The level of the spell is the highest level of spells you can cast.

Additionally, your effective caster level for fire spells is 1 higher.

Fiery Burst
Level: Special
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium ( 100 feet + 10 feet per caster level)
Area: 10-ft.-radius spread
Duration: Instantaneous
Saving Throw: Reflex negates
Spell Resistance: Yes
Tags: Fire

You create a burst of flame at a location of your choosing. Those in the area may make a reflex save to negate the damage. Those who fail suffer d4 per (level+1)/2 fire damage. Flammable objects in the area, like papers and tinder, ignite.

Icy Breath
Effect

You learn a special spell called icy breath for which you do not need to expend spell slots to cast. The level of the spell is the highest level of spells you can cast.

Additionally, your effective caster level for cold spells is 1 higher.

Icy Breath
Level: Special
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: 20 ft.
Area: Cone-shaped burst
Duration: Instantaneous
Saving Throw: Reflex negates
Tags: Cold

You create a blast of icy cold that freezes people. Those in the cone who fail their saves take d6 per (level+1)/2 cold damage.

Chain Shock
Effect

You learn a special spell called chain shock for which you do not need to expend spell slots to cast. The level of the spell is the highest level of spells you can cast.

Additionally, your effective caster level for lightning spells is 1 higher.

Chain Shock
Level: Special
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium ( 100 feet + 10 feet per caster level)
Targets: One primary target, plus one secondary target within 10 feet of the primary target.
Duration: Instantaneous
Saving Throw: Reflex negates
Tags: Lightning

You create an arc of lighting that strikes a creature and then arcs from them to another creature. The primary target takes d8 per (level+1)/2 lightning damage and the second target takes half as much.

If you target a creature in a grapple, it targets both of them.

Acidic Splatter
Effect

You learn a special spell called acidic splatter for which you do not need to expend spell slots to cast. The level of the spell is the highest level of spells you can cast.

Additionally, your effective caster level for acid spells is 1 higher.

Acidic Splatter
Level: Special
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium ( 100 feet + 10 feet per caster level)
Targets: One target
Duration: Instantaneous
Saving Throw: Reflex negates
Spell Resistance: Yes
Tags: Acid

You create a blob of acid that eats away flesh, steel, bone. If the target fails to evade it, they suffer 1d10 per (level+1)/2 acid damage.

Thief Feats

Spy

Effect

+4 to disguise, bluff, gather information and forgery.

Assassin

Effect

Once per turn when you deal sneak attack damage while hiding in shadows, you gain bonus damage equal to twice your level.

Master Thief

Effect

+1 to all thief skills +2 to stealth

Lucky Thief

Effect

Gain two luck points that recover each long rest.

If you roll a 1 on a thief skill or a DEX skill, reroll it.

You can spend a luck point to reroll a thief skill or any DEX skill.

Lucky Recovery

Effect

Gain two luck points that recover each long rest.

If you roll a 1 on any CHA check, reroll it.

You can spend a luck point to reroll any CHA skill.

Lucky Save

Effect

Gain one luck point that recovers each long rest.

If you roll a 1 on a saving throw, reroll it.

You can spend a luck point to reroll a failed saving throw.

Lucky Shot

Effect

Gain two luck points that recover each long rest.

When you roll a 1 on a critical hit confirmation roll, reroll it.

Whenever you fail to confirm a critical hit, you can spend a luck point to confirm it instead.

Better Lucky Than Good

Prerequisite

Any two luck feats.

Effect

Gain two luck points that recover each long rest.

When you roll a 1 on a d20 roll and you would reroll it due to one of your luck feats, you can instead spend a luck point to replace that roll with a natural 20.

Improved Hide

Effect

Creatures with the scent skill roll against your hide check instead of a fixed DC.

Creatures with blindsight need to roll against your hide check as well.

Improved Flanking

Effect

You are considered flanking if you and an ally are at least 90 degrees from each other.

Skilled

Effect

Pick one skill. That skill gets a +3 bonus.

Additionally, you gain 2 skill points which you can spend immediately.

Skirmisher

Effect

If you are able to maneuver around, your opponent's partially weakened defenses allows a partial sneak attack.

If you move at least 10 feet before you attack, deal ½ of your sneak attack damage even if you would not otherwise qualify.

Cloak of Shadows

Effect

Once per battle, you can become invisible as per the greater invisibility spell as a swift action. The effect lasts until the end of your turn.

Phantom

Effect

When your hide in shadows or an invisibility type spell on you would normally end, they instead last until the start of your next turn.

Plagiarize

Effect

Gain one of the following abilities

  • Learn 1 level 1 spell from any class. You can use it once per long rest.
  • Turn Undead once per long rest
  • Inspire Courage bardic music once per long rest

Any factors based on a class level use your thief level. You use charisma for in place of the normal ability score for spell DCs.

When you have downtime, you can swap to a different choice without spending any extra downtime.

Ambusher

Effect

If you would get a surprise round, you roll a 20 on your initiative check.

Your party gets +2 to initiative. If multiple party members have this feat, this benefit does not stack.

+1 on stealth checks

Poisoner

Effect

You can prepare and apply a poison to your weapons. Others can't use it because they suck and would poison and kill themselves.

This is evil.

Any enemy that you have dealt damage to with a weapon attack takes an additional 1 damage at the start of each of their turns. Additionally, the effectiveness of fast healing, regeneration, and any other healing effect on them is halved.

This effect lasts until they receive first aid in the form of a DC 12 heal check or any form of magical healing.

Wizard Feats

Special Rules

Some wizard feats are a "tutelage" feat. They represent how you originally learned your magic. As a result, you can only have 1 of these and must take it at 1st level.

Infernal Tutelage

Tutelage
Effect

To learn your magic, you sold your soul to a devil. You were crafty enough to get a bit more out of the deal, but make no mistake - your soul is damned.

If you die, your soul is immediately whisked off to hell. You cannot be raised from the dead or reincarnated.

The devil you dealt with is willing to make future bargains.

You gain the below benefits:

Fiendish Vigor

You gain +1 hp/level

Devil's Sight

You gain 120' darkvision.

Fires of Hell

Your fire spells deal +1 damage per die.

Arcane Tutelage

Tutelage
Effect

You learned your magic the traditional way, by being apprenticed to a master wizard.

You know an additional two 1st level spells at level 1.

It takes half the time and gold to scribe spells into your spellbook

You can cast prestdigitation at will.

At 1st level you gain an extra 1st level slot. At 4th level you gain an extra 2nd level slot. At 8th level you gain an extra 3rd level slot.

Elvish Tutelage

Tutelage
Effect

You learned your magic by studying and living amongst the elves. Perhaps you are an elf. You must be at least 60 years old.

You can cast magic while wearing a chain shirt. You gain proficiency in the chain shirt. You can cast while wearing chainmail, but do not gain profiicciency in it (this is for the fighter/wizards).

You also gain proficiency in the shortsword, longsword, shortbow and longbow.

You can deliver ranged touch attacks (like scorching ray, acid arrow) via the arrows from your bow. They are still ranged touch attacks. If delivered this way, you also deal arrow damage.

You can deliver melee touch attacks via your sword. They are still melee touch attacks. If delivered this way, you also deal sword damage.

Witch

Tutelage
Prerequisite

Female

Effect

You are a witch and were taught by a witch's coven.

You have a broomstick you can fly on outdoors. It can carry only you and your gear.

+2 to alchemy.

Your familiar is sassier and can talk.

You can curse (voodoo) those you don't like (as per bestow curse), by performing a ritual with a personal item or token of theirs (lock of their hair, their sword, etc.)

You are spookier. Any fear spell you cast is +1 DC.

Researcher

Effect

You get +3 to checks to research spells and researching spells costs half the amount of material components.

You research one additional spell every level.

Perfect Spell Memory

Effect

Once you have learned a spell, you know that spell even without access to a spellbook. Thus, you can always prepare any spell you have ever learned. You still must write it into a spellbook in order to learn it.

Spell Potency

Effect

Add a +2 bonus on caster level checks. (Affects spell resistance and dispel magic, etc). Note that this does not effect things that scale with your level (fireball will not deal more d6s of damage).

Mobile Spellcasting

Prerequisite

Dodge

Effect

You can move before and after you cast a spell (up to your normal maximum).

Double Wand Wielder

Effect

You can "dual wield" wands, using both as a single standard action. This expends twice as many charges from each wand.

Wand Master

Effect

Wands you use are at +1 caster level.

When you use a wand that only has 1 charge left, there is a 50% chance that it regains a charge (returning it to 1 charge).

Equipment

Encumbrance

You can carry your strength score in slots without being encumbered.

See the backpack for an easy way to carry more. Without a backpack, a character is limited to just what they can wear and carry in their arms. Something like a basket enables you to carry more in your arms. The drawback of the backpack is it is slow to retrieve items from it.

A sack allows a character to carry more than 200 coins. Without a sack, they are limited to 200 coins. You can fill a large sack with stuff and sling it over your shoulder, but this requires you to hold onto it and there is no weight distribution advantage like with the backpack.

A weapon sheath allows them to carry a 1-handed weapon on their belt or two light weapons. A holster lets them carry a pistol as well. You can have at most two weapons on your belt.

A belt pouch allows you to carry small items on your waist. You can have two belt pouches, typically with a potion or scroll or whatever.

A bandolier goes across the chest and has two pouches. Additionally, a pistol can be holstered on it. A bandolier cannot be worn with medium or heavy armor.

Heavily Encumbered

You can carry up to double your carrying capacity and be heavily encumbered.

Heavily encumbered means:

  • Move at half speed
  • -4 penalty to attacks, saves, skill checks, spell dcs
  • Automatically fail trip checks
  • twice as many wandering monsters are rolled for (this is on top of moving half as far between checks)

Slots

Weapons, armor and equipment lists how many slots they are in their descriptions.
Thing Slots
1000 coins 1
Day of supplies 1
Potions 1/4
Scrolls 1/10

Supplies

  • You need supplies or you die.
  • After 1 day without supplies, you become fatigued.
  • Half a day later you become exhausted.
  • Half a day after that you die.

Ammunition

Ammo Cost Slots
Bullets and Powder (10) 3gp 1
Sling Bullets (10) 1sp 1
Crossbow Bolts (20) 1gp 1
Arrows (20) 1gp 1

Weapon Rules

Weapon Proficiency

Characters can only use weapons they are proficient with. They attack ineffectively with other weapons.

Weapon Size

Each weapon has a size which is the size of creature it is designed for. The damage entries in the weapon table are for medium creatures. For unusual sizes, use the table below

Example Weapon Tiny Small Medium Large Huge Gargantuan Colossal
Dagger 1d2 1d3 1d4 1d6 1d8 2d6 3d6
Shortspear 1d3 1d4 1d6 1d8 2d6 3d6 4d6
Falchion 1d4 1d6 2d4 2d6 3d6 4d6 6d6
Longsword 1d4 1d6 1d8 2d6 3d6 4d6 6d6
Bastard Sword 1d6 1d8 1d10 2d8 3d8 4d8 6d8
Greataxe 1d8 1d10 1d12 3d6 4d6 6d6 8d6

Range Increment

Any attack at less than this distance is not penalized for range. However, each full range increment imposes a cumulative -2 penalty on the attack roll. A thrown weapon has a maximum range of five range increments. A projectile weapon can shoot out to ten range increments.

Weapon Descriptions

Bastard Sword
Damage (M): 1d10
Damage (S): 1d8
Critical: 19-20/x2
Range Inc: -
Slots: 2
Damage Type: Slashing
Hands: 1-handed
Reach: 5'

A bastard sword requires special training (exotic weapon proficiency) and strength 13 to wield in one hand.

Battleaxe
Damage (M): 1d8
Damage (S): 1d6
Critical: x3
Range Inc: -
Slots: 1.5
Damage Type: Slashing
Hands: 1-handed
Reach: 5'

Blunderbuss
Damage (M): 1d12
Damage (S): 1d10
Critical: x3
Range Inc: 30'
Slots: 2
Damage Type: Piercing
Hands: 2-handed
Reload: full round action

Blunderbusses must be reloaded after firing, which provokes attacks of opportunity.

A blunderbuss is a firearm. On a roll of natural 1, the weapon is fouled and cannot be fired until unfouled (a process that takes 5 minutes).

When firing at a creature within 30', you can target an additional creature adjacent to your target with the same attack roll. Roll only once and apply to both.

Club
Damage (M): 1d6
Damage (S): 1d4
Critical: x2
Range Inc: 10'
Slots: 1
Damage Type: Bludgeoning
Hands: 1-handed
Reach: 5'

Clubs may be thrown.

Clubs don't need to be purchased - any sturdy piece of wood will do.

Cutlass
Damage (M): 1d6
Damage (S): 1d4
Critical: 18-20/x2
Range Inc: -
Slots: 1
Damage Type: Slashing
Hands: 1-handed
Reach: 5'

Dagger
Damage (M): 1d4
Damage (S): 1d3
Critical: 19-20/x2
Range Inc: 10'
Slots: 0.5
Damage Type: Piercing or Slashing
Hands: Light
Reach: 5'

Daggers may be thrown.

Daggers are much easier to conceal than other weapons. You get +2 to conceal a dagger.

Dwarven Waraxe
Damage (M): 1d10
Damage (S): 1d8
Critical: x3
Range Inc: -
Slots: 2
Damage Type: Slashing
Hands: 1-handed
Reach: 5'

A dwarven waraxe requires special training (exotic weapon proficiency) and strength 13 to wield in one hand.

Falchion
Damage (M): 2d4
Damage (S): 1d6
Critical: 18-20/x2
Range Inc: -
Slots: 2
Damage Type: Slashing
Hands: 2-handed
Reach: 5'

Glaive
Damage (M): 1d10
Damage (S): 1d8
Critical: 19-20/x2
Range Inc: -
Slots: 3
Damage Type: Slashing
Hands: 2-handed
Reach: 10'

A glaive has reach. You can strike opponents 10 feet away with it, but you can’t use it against an adjacent foe.

Greataxe
Damage (M): 1d12
Damage (S): 1d10
Critical: x3
Range Inc: -
Slots: 2
Damage Type: Slashing
Hands: 2-handed
Reach: 5'

Damage Type: Bludgeoning
Hands: 2-handed
Reach: 5'
