The augury can see into the future only about half an hour, so anything that might happen after that does not affect the result. Thus, the result might not take into account the long-term consequences of a contemplated action. All auguries cast by the same person about the same topic use the same dice result as the first casting.

Baleful Transposition
Level: Sorcerer 2
Components: V
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: Two creatures of up to large size.
Saving Throw: Will negates
Tags: Teleportation

Two target creatures, of which you can be one, instantly swap positions. Both subjects must be within range. Either or both can save against this effect. If either makes the save, the spell is foiled.

Objects carried by the creatures (up to the creatures’ maximum loads) go with them, but other creatures do not, even if they are carried.

Bane
Level: Cleric 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: 50'
Area: All enemies within 50'
Duration: 1 min/levle
Saving Throw: Will negates

Bane fills your enemies with divine fear and doubt. Each affected creature takes a -1 sacred penalty on attack rolls and a -1 sacred penalty on saving throws against fear effects.

Barkskin
Level: Druid 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 creature touched
Duration: 10 min/level

Barkskin turns the touched creature's skin into bark, which is effectively "natural" armor. This gives them a +4 armor bonus to AC +1 / 4 levels (so +5 at level 4, +6 at level 8).

This armor does not stack with regular armor.

This effect persists through wildshapes.

Bear's Endurance
Level: Wizard 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 creature touched other than the caster
Duration: 10 min/level

The touched creature constitution score becomes 19. This spell has no effect on those with a constitution higher than this. Enhancement effects do not enhance this score further.

Note that the hit points gained from this are not lost first like temporary hit points are - when the spell wears off, the character may find themselves unconscious. This sudden loss of hitpoints can only reduce a character to -5.

Benign Transposition
Level: Sorcerer 1
Components: V
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: Two willing creatures of up to large size.
Tags: Teleportation

Two target creatures, of which you can be one, instantly swap positions. Both subjects must be within range.

Objects carried by the creatures (up to the creatures’ maximum loads) go with them, but other creatures do not, even if they are carried.

Bestow Curse
Level: Wizard 4, Cleric 3
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Touch
Targets: Person or Object
Duration: 10 min/level (Person) or Permanent (Object)
Saving Throw: Will Negates

When cast on a person (man shaped-creature of man-size or smaller), the curse can have one of the following effects (roll percentile dice):

d100 Curse
01-50 random ability score is reduce to 3 (roll a d6)
51-75 -4 penalty to attack and saving throws
76-100 At the beginning of each turn, 50% to do nothing.

When cast on a weapon:

d100 Curse
01-25 Weapon strikes wielder instead.
26-50 Weapon suffers -4 penalty to attack and damage.
51-75 Weapon returns to wielder's sheath whenever an attack is made.
76-100 Weapon becomes a noodle.

The effect is permanent on non-magical weaponry and lasts 10min/level on magical weaponry.

When cast on armor:

d100 Curse
01-25 Armor suffers -4 AC
26-50 Armor is 50% to trip wearer whenever he moves (ending their movement)
51-75 Armor attracts all attacks upon it.
76-100 Wearer is totally encumbered.

The effect is permanent on non-magical armor and lasts 10min/level on magical armor.

Whenever a player casts a curse, they must devise one of similar power (DM may tweak it). It is then permanently added to the table. Beware! Evil clerics will be casting it!

Betrayal of Flesh
Level: Sorcerer 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: 1 fleshy creature
Duration: 1 minute/level
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates

The creature is assaulted by a voracious disease that begins to eat their flesh. They take 1d6 damage at the start of each of their turns until they take fire damage to burn the rot out or the spell ends.

Bless
Level: Cleric 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: 50'
Area: The caster and all allies within 50'
Duration: 1 min/level

Bless fills your allies with divine courage. Each ally gains a +1 sacred bonus on attack rolls and on saving throws.

Blindness/Deafness
Level: Bard 2, Cleric 3, Sorcerer 2, Wizard 2
Components: V
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: One living creature
Duration: Permanent
Saving Throw: Fortitude Negates

You call upon the powers of unlife to render the subject blinded or deafened, as you choose.

Blur
Level: Bard 2, Sorcerer 2, Wizard 2
Components: V
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Touch
Targets: Creature touched
Duration: 1 min/level

The subject’s outline appears blurred, shifting and wavering. This distortion grants the subject concealment (20% miss chance).

A see invisibility spell does not counteract the blur effect, but a true seeing spell does.

Opponents that cannot see the subject ignore the spell’s effect (though fighting an unseen opponent carries penalties of its own).

Bone Bomb
Level: Wizard 1
Components: V, S, M (bones to make the bombs)
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Duration: 10 min/level

You create 3 bombs out of bone. The bombs can be hurled as a grenade-like weapon or set to trigger when a creature is adjacent to them. In either case, they deal 3d4 piercing damage and allow a reflex save for half damage. A direct hit by a hurled bomb allows no such save.

Bull's Strength
Level: Wizard 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 creature touched other than the caster
Duration: 10 min/level

The touched creature strength score becomes 19. This spell has no effect on those with a strength higher than this. Enhancement effects do not enhance this score further.

Buoyancy
Level: Druid 1
Components: V
Casting Time: 1 immediate action
Range: Close (25' + 5'/2 levels)
Targets: One willing creature/ level, no two of which are more than 20 ft. apart
Duration: 1 minute/ level (D)

The subjects of this spell are borne toward the surface at 60 feet per round until they are floating on it, regardless of their weight, equipment, lack of swimming skill, etc.

The subject then rests at the top of the liquid (rescuing it from drowning if it was a sinking air-breather) and can swim away under its own power or be moved by others (such as with a rope).

If the subject is removed from the liquid, the spell ends.

Burning Hands
Level: Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: 15'
Area: Cone-shaped
Saving Throw: Reflex half
Tags: Fire

A cone of searing flame shoots from your fingertips. Any creature in the area of the flames takes 1d4 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 5d4).

His hands must be held so as to send forth a fanlike sheet of flames: The caster's thumbs must touch each other and the fingers must be spread.

Flammable materials burn if the flames touch them.

Calm Animals
Level: Druid 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close( 25' + 5'/2 levels)
Targets: Animals within 30' of each other
Saving Throw: Will negates

This spell soothes and quiets animals, rendering them docile and harmless. Only natural animals can be affected by this spell.

All the subjects must be of the same kind, and no two may be more than 30 feet apart.

The maximum number of Hit Dice of animals you can affect is equal to 2d4 + caster level.

A dire animal or an animal trained to attack or guard is allowed a saving throw; other animals are not.

The affected creatures remain where they are and do not attack or flee. They are not helpless and defend themselves normally if attacked.

Any threat breaks the spell on the threatened creatures.

Calm Emotions
Level: Bard 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: Creatures in a 20' radius spread
Duration: Concentration, up to 1 rd / level
Saving Throw: Will Negates

This spell calms agitated creatures. You have no control over the affected creatures, but calm emotions can stop raging creatures from fighting or joyous ones from reveling.

Creatures so affected cannot take violent actions (although they can defend themselves) or do anything destructive.

Any aggressive action against or damage dealt to a calmed creature immediately breaks the spell on all calmed creatures.

This spell automatically suppresses (but does not dispel) any morale bonuses granted by spells such as good hope as well as negating a bard’s ability to inspire courage or a barbarian’s rage ability.

It also suppresses any fear effects.

While the spell lasts, a suppressed spell or effect has no effect.

When the calm emotions spell ends, the original spell or effect takes hold of the creature again, provided that its duration has not expired in the meantime.

Cat's Grace
Level: Wizard 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 creature touched other than the caster
Duration: 10 min/level

The touched creature dexterity score becomes 19. This spell has no effect on those with a dexterity higher than this. Enhancement effects do not enhance this score further.

Cause Fear
Level: Bard 1, Cleric 1, Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V,S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close(25' + 5' per two levels)
Targets: One living creature with 5 or fewer hit dice
Duration: 1d4 rounds
Saving Throw: Will negates
Tags: Fear

The affected creature becomes frightened. Creatures with 6 or more Hit Dice are immune to this effect.

Chain Missiles
Level: Sorcerer 3
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)

You fire a barrage of magic missiles. You fire one missile per two levels. All missiles target 1 creature, striking him for 1d4+1 damage each. Then, one missile disappears and the other missiles move to strike a different creature of your choice. This process repeats until there are no more missiles.

For example, a 6th level sorcerer casts this spell. He sends 3 missiles at an orc, then 2 at a goblin and then 1 at a kobold.

The missile strikes unerringly, even if the target is in melee combat or has less than total cover or total concealment. Specific parts of a creature can’t be singled out. Inanimate objects are not damaged by the spell.

Charm Animal
Level: Druid 1
Components: V,S
Casting Time: 1 round
Range: Close (25' + 5' per two levels)
Targets: One natural animal.
Duration: 1 hour / level (but see text)
Saving Throw: Will negates
Tags: Charm

This spell applies to all natural animals.

This charm makes an animal regard you as its trusted friend and ally. Essentially, the creature will join your party.

If the creature is currently being threatened or attacked by you or your allies, however, it receives a +5 bonus on its saving throw.

The spell does not enable you to control the charmed animal as if it were an automaton, but it perceives your words and actions in the most favorable way.

You can try to give the subject orders, but you must win an opposed Charisma check to convince it to do anything it wouldn’t ordinarily do.

An affected creature never obeys suicidal or obviously harmful orders, but it might be convinced that something very dangerous is worth doing.

Any act by you or your apparent allies that threatens the charmed animal breaks the spell.

When the spell ends, the creature must save again or the spell is permanent. It still ends if you or your apparent allies attack or threaten the charmed subject. A permanent charm animal can be dispelled as any other spell can be. A creature who succeeds on this save may pretend to still be under the sway of it to get its revenge on you. Thus this second save is rolled in secret.

A caster can only charm up to 1 creature per level of experience.

A creature who resists this spell can never come under your charm.

Charm Person
Level: Bard 1, Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V,S
Casting Time: 1 round
Range: Close (25' + 5' per two levels)
Targets: One human-ish creature.
Duration: 1 hour / level (but see text)
Saving Throw: Will negates
Tags: Charm

This spell applies to all two-legged, generally mammalian figures near to or less than man-size, excluding all monsters in the Undead class but including Sprites, Pixies, Nixies, Kobolds, Goblins, Orcs, Hobgoblins and Gnolls.

This charm makes a humanish creature regard you as its trusted friend and ally. Essentially, the creature will join your party.

If the creature is currently being threatened or attacked by you or your allies, however, it receives a +5 bonus on its saving throw.

The spell does not enable you to control the charmed person as if it were an automaton, but it perceives your words and actions in the most favorable way. If it accompanies you on adventure, it will demand a full share of the treasure however.

You can try to give the subject orders, but you must win an opposed Charisma check to convince it to do anything it wouldn’t ordinarily do.

An affected creature never obeys suicidal or obviously harmful orders, but it might be convinced that something very dangerous is worth doing.

Any act by you or your apparent allies that threatens the charmed person breaks the spell.

You must speak the person’s language to communicate your commands, or else be good at pantomiming.

When the spell ends, the creature must save again or the spell is permanent. It still ends if you or your apparent allies attack or threaten the charmed subject. A permanent charm person can be dispelled as any other spell can be. A creature who succeeds on this save may pretend to still be under the sway of it to get its revenge on you. Thus this second save is rolled in secret.

A caster can only charm up to 1 creature per level of experience.

A creature who resists this spell can never come under your charm.

Chill/Heat Metal
Level: Druid 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25' + 5'/2 levels)
Targets: Metal equipment of one creature per two levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart; or 25 lb. of metal/level, none of which can be more than 30 ft. away from any of the rest
Duration: 7 rounds
Saving Throw: Will Negates

Heat metal makes metal extremely warm. Unattended, nonmagical metal gets no saving throw. Magical metal is allowed a saving throw against the spell. An item in a creature’s possession uses the creature’s saving throw bonus unless its own is higher.

A creature takes fire damage if its equipment is heated. It takes full damage if its armor is affected or if it is holding, touching, wearing, or carrying metal weighing one-fifth of its weight. The creature takes minimum damage if it’s not wearing metal armor and the metal that it’s carrying weighs less than one-fifth of its weight.

The hot metal causes 2d4 points of fire damage to the one in contact (minimum damage is thus 2).

Chill metal works the same, but makes the metal painfully cold.

Color Spray
Level: Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V, S, M (A pinch each of powder or sand that is colored red, yellow, and blue)
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Area: 15' cone
Duration: see text
Saving Throw: Will negates
Tags: Mind-affecting

A vivid cone of clashing colors springs forth from your hand, causing creatures to become stunned, or blinded, and or unconscious.

Sightless creatures are not affected by color spray.

Each creature within the cone is affected according to its Hit Dice relative to the caster's level.

Hit Dice ≤ caster's struck unconscious for 2d4 rounds
Hit Dice ≤ caster's+2 blinded 1d4 rounds
Hit Dice ≥ caster's+3 stunned for 1 round

Combust
Level: Sorcerer 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 creature touched
Tags: Fire

This spell makes a combustible object or a creature’s combustible equipment burst into flame, even if damp.

You deliver this spell as a melee touch attack. When you cast this spell, you can deliver the touch attack as a free action that turn. If you miss, you can try again on subsequent turns or until 10 minutes passes.

If the target is a creature, the initial eruption of flame causes 1d8 points of fire damage per caster level with no saving throw. Further, the creature must make a DC 15 Reflex save or catch fire .

If the target is a combustible, unattended object, the initial eruption of flame deals fire damage to the object as noted above. The object catches fire and takes 1d6 points of fire damage each round until consumed or someone puts out the fire.

Command Undead
Level: Wizard 2
Components: V,S,M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25' + 5'/2 levels)
Targets: 1 undead creature
Duration: 1 day/level
Saving Throw: Special

When cast against an intelligent undead creature, this spell acts like Charm Person, but for undead.

Against unintelligent undead, there is no saving throw and it falls under your command. It can have no more than hit dice than you do. You can control up to your level in mindless undead this way (thus a 5th level wizard could control 5 undead with at most 5 hit dice each).

When you control a mindless being, you can communicate only basic commands, such as “come here,” “go there,” “fight,” “stand still,” and so on. Nonintelligent undead won’t resist suicidal or obviously harmful orders.

Your commands are not telepathic. The undead creature must be able to hear you.

Command
Level: Cleric 1
Components: V
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25' + 5'/2 levels)
Targets: One living creature
Duration: 1 round
Saving Throw: Will negates

You give the subject a single command, which it obeys to the best of its ability at its earliest opportunity. You may select from the following options, or another similar one you make up.

If the subject can’t carry out your command on its next turn, the spell automatically fails.

Approach

On its turn, the subject moves toward you as quickly and directly as possible for 1 round. The creature may do nothing but move during its turn, and it provokes attacks of opportunity for this movement as normal.

Drop

On its turn, the subject drops whatever it is holding. It can’t pick up any dropped item until its next turn.

Fall

On its turn, the subject falls to the ground and remains prone for 1 round. It may act normally while prone but takes any appropriate penalties.

Flee

On its turn, the subject moves away from you as quickly as possible for 1 round. It may do nothing but move during its turn, and it provokes attacks of opportunity for this movement as normal.

Halt

The subject stands in place for 1 round. It may not take any actions but is not considered helpless.

Comprehend Languages
Level: Wizard 1
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 round
Duration: 1 min/level

When this spell is cast, the wizard is able to understand the spoken words of a creature or read an otherwise incomprehensible written message (such as writing in another language).

In either case, the wizard must touch the creature or the writing.

Note that the ability to read does not necessarily impart understanding of the material, nor does the spell enable the caster to speak or write an unknown language.

Written material can be read at the rate of one page or equivalent per round.

Magical writing cannot be read, other than to know it is magical, but the spell is often useful when deciphering treasure maps.

This spell can be foiled by certain warding magic (the level secret page and illusionary script spells), and it does not reveal messages concealed in otherwise normal text.

Control Flame
Level: Druid 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Area: 30' radius
Duration: 1 minute

This spell has two modes: you can either make fire burn in the area more intensely or less intensely.

Fire that leaves the area remains affected by the spell. Fire brought into the area is also affected by the spell.

More Intense

All normal fires within the affected area flare up, burning twice as hot and twice as bright.

The illumination radii of all nonmagical fires double (so a torch casts bright illumination in a 40-foot radius), and all nonmagical fires deal double damage (so a creature that catches on fire takes 2d6 points of fire damage per round).

Fire affected by this spell burns out twice as quickly, so a torch that is the subject of the spell burns out in 30 minutes instead of the normal hour.

Magical fire in the area, such as from a produce flame or fireball spell, burns hotter, dealing +1 point of fire damage per die.

Less Intense

All normal fires wiithin the affected area flare down, burning half as hot and half as bright.

The illumination radii of all nonmagical fires halve (so a torch casts bright illumination in a 10-foot radius), and all nonmagical fires deal half damage (so a creature that catches on fire takes 1d3 points of fire damage per round).

Fire affected by this spell burns out half as quickly, so a torch that is the subject of the spell burns out in 2 hours instead of the normal hour.

Magical fire in the area, such as from a produce flame or fireball spell, burns cooler, dealing -1 point of fire damage per die.

Corrosive Grasp
Level: Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Touch
Targets: Self
Duration: 4 hours or until you run out of charges
Tags: Acid

When you cast this spell, one of your hands is coated with deadly acid. A touch attack with this hand causes 1d8 points of acid damage.

You can use this melee touch attack up to one time per level.

You can also deal this damage as extra damage with an unarmed strike or an attack with a natural weapon.

If you grapple an opponent, you can deal this damage in addition to other damage you deal via grappling.

When you finish casting this spell, you can make a touch attack with that hand as a free action this turn.

Create Water
Level: Cleric 0, Druid 0
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action

This spell generates wholesome, drinkable water, just like clean rain water. Water can be created in an area as small as will actually contain the liquid, or in an area three times as large—possibly creating a downpour or filling many small receptacles. Do note how little a gallon is when spread out.

Cure Critical Wounds
Level: Cleric 4
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Touch
Tags: Healing

You lay your hand on a creature, channel positive energy and heal them of 4d8+1/level (max + 20) hit points of damage.

Cure Light Wounds
Level: Bard 1, Cleric 1, Druid 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Touch
Tags: Healing

You lay your hand on a creature, channel positive energy and heal them of 1d8+1/level (max + 5) hit points of damage.

Cure Minor Wounds
Level: Cleric 0, Druid 0
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Touch
Tags: Healing

You lay your hand on a creature, channel positive energy and heal them of 1 hit point of damage.

Cure Moderate Wounds
Level: Bard 2, Cleric 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Touch
Tags: Healing

You lay your hand on a creature, channel positive energy and heal them of 2d8+1/level (max + 10) hit points of damage.

Cure Serious Wounds
Level: Bard 3, Cleric 3
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Touch
Tags: Healing

You lay your hand on a creature, channel positive energy and heal them of 3d8+1/level (max + 15) hit points of damage.

Curse of Impending Blades
Level: Bard 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: One creature
Duration: 1 minute
Saving Throw: Will Negates

The target of the spell has a hard time avoiding attacks, sometimes even seeming to stumble into harm’s way. The subject takes a –2 penalty to AC.

The curse cannot be dispelled, but it can be removed with a break enchantment, limited wish, miracle, removecurse, or wish spell (which would be quite the waste).

Curse Potion
Level: Wizard 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 minute
Targets: 1 touched potion
Duration: 1 day/level
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates

You curse a potion, turning it into a potion of poison. If a creature drinks it, they must make a fortitude save or die from the poison.

Dancing Lights
Level: Gnome 0, Bard 0
Components: V,S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Duration: 1 minute
Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)
Effect: Up to four lights, all within a 10-ft.-radius area
Tags: Light

There are three versions of this spell

  • Four lights that resemble lanterns and cast light like a torch
  • Four glowing spheres of light
  • One faintly glowing, vaguely humanoid shape

The dancing lights must stay within a 10-foot-radius area in relation to each other but otherwise move as you desire (no concentration required): forward or back, up or down, straight or turning corners, or the like.

The lights can move up to 100 feet per round. A light winks out if the distance between you and it exceeds the spell’s range.

Darkness
Level: Bard 2, Cleric 2, Sorcerer 2, Wizard 2
Components: V
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Touch
Targets: Objected touched
Duration: 10 min/level (D)

This spell makes a 20' radius globe of complete blackness that "shines" out from an object.

Sight through the darkness is impossible, even by darkvision. A creature in the darkness is totally concealed and effectively blinded.

If the darkness touches a low level light spell, that light spell is dispelled. If it touchs an equal level light spell, the darkness and the light spell mutually dispel, and if it touches a higher level light spell the darkness spell is dispelled.

Daylight
Level: Bard 3, Cleric 3, Sorcerer 3, Wizard 3
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 touched object
Duration: 10 min/level
Tags: Light

The object touched sheds light as bright as full daylight in a 60-foot radius, and dim light for an additional 60 feet beyond that.

Creatures that take penalties in bright light also take them while within the radius of this magical light. This spell is the equivalent of daylight for the purposes of creatures that are damaged or destroyed by bright light.

If daylight is cast on a small object that is then placed inside or under a light-proof covering, the spell’s effects are blocked until the covering is removed.

Daylight brought into an area of magical darkness of a lower level dispels it. If it is equal level, they mutually dispel each other.

Daze Monster
Level: Bard 2, Sorcerer 2, Wizard 2
Components: V, S, M (Pinch of Wool)
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: One living creature of 6hd or less
Duration: 1 round
Saving Throw: Will negates

The creature is dazed.

Daze
Level: Sorcerer 0
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)
Targets: One medium sized creature of 4 HD or less
Duration: 1 round
Saving Throw: Will negates
Tags: Mind-affecting

This enchantment clouds the mind of a medium creature with 4 or fewer Hit Dice so that it takes no actions.

Creatures of 5 or more HD are not affected.

A dazed subject is not stunned, so attackers get no special advantage against it.

Deep Slumber
Level: Bard 3, Sorcerer 3, Wizard 3
Components: V, S, M (A pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a live cricket)
Casting Time: 1 round
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Area: One or more living creatures within a 10' radius burst
Duration: 1 min/level
Saving Throw: Will negates

A deep slumber spell causes a magical slumber to come upon 10 Hit Dice of creatures. Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first.

Among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the spell’s point of origin are affected first. Hit Dice that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.

Sleeping creatures are helpless. Slapping or wounding awakens an affected creature, but normal noise does not. Awakening a creature is a standard action (an application of the aid another action).

Sleep does not target unconscious creatures, constructs, or undead creatures.

When the duration ends, the creatures continue sleeping naturally, but may wake up due to normal noise or other normal ways of waking a creature.

Delay Poison
Level: Bard 2, Cleric 2, Druid 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 creature touched
Duration: 1 hour / level

The subject becomes temporarily immune to poison. Any poison in its system or any poison to which it is exposed during the spell’s duration does not affect the subject until the spell’s duration has expired. Delay poison does not cure any damage that poison may have already done.

Delusions of Grandeur
Level: Bard 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: One creature
Duration: 10 min/level
Saving Throw: Will negates

This powerful phantasm fools the subject into believing itself more competent and safe than it really is. The spell makes any action the subject considers attempting seem easily accomplished, requiring only a token effort.

Deadly wounds seem like mere scratches, stalwart foes appear weak and intimidated, and the subject’s own attacks seem stronger and more effective.

As a result of its skewed perceptions, the subject takes a –2 penalty on attack rolls, saves, ability checks, and skill checks, as well as to Wisdom.

Finally, the subject becomes so completely enamored with its own (false) abilities that it cannot fight defensively or take the total defense action.

The affected creature must have an ego (so beasts, slimes are not affected, etc.).

Detect Chaos/Evil/Good/Law
Level: Cleric 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: 60'
Area: Cone
Duration: Concentration, up to 10 min/level (D)

You can sense the presence of chaos/evil/good/law (pick only one when you cast it). The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area or subject.

1st Full Round: Presence or absence of evil.

2nd Full Round: Number of evil auras (creatures, objects, or spells) in the area and the power of the most potent evil aura present.

If you are of good alignment, and the strongest evil aura’s power is overwhelming, and the HD or level of the aura’s source is at least twice your character level, you are stunned for 1 round and the spell ends.

3rd Full Round: The power and location of each aura. If an aura is outside your line of sight, then you discern its direction but not its exact location.

The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.

Detect Magic
Level: Bard 0, Cleric 0, Druid 0, Sorcerer 0, Wizard 0
Components: V,S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: 60'
Area: Cone-shaped emanation
Duration: Concentration, up to 1 min./level (D)

You detect magical auras. You must focus upon an object or area to detect its magic aura. This generally takes 1 round.

Illusion spells give off no aura.

The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.

Detect Poison
Level: Cleric 0, Druid 0, Wizard 0
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Area: One creature, one object, or a 5-ft. cube

You determine whether a creature, object, or area has been poisoned or is poisonous. You can determine the exact type of poison with a DC 20 Wisdom check.

The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.

Detect Secret Doors
Level: Bard 1, Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 minute
Range: 60'
Duration: 1 min/level (D)

You can detect secret doors, compartments, caches, and so forth. Only passages, doors, or openings that have been specifically constructed to escape detection are detected by this spell.

This spell reveals the presence of these doors and compartments, but not how to open them.

The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.

Detect Undead
Level: Cleric 1, Wizard 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: 60'
Area: Cone
Duration: Concentration, up to 10 min/level (D)

You can sense the presence of undead . The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area or subject.

1st Full Round: Presence or absence of undead.

2nd Full Round: Number of undead auras (creatures, objects, or spells) in the area and the power of the most potent undead aura present.

If you are living, and the strongest undead aura’s power is overwhelming, and the HD or level of the aura’s source is at least twice your character level, you are stunned for 1 round and the spell ends.

3rd Full Round: The power and location of each aura. If an aura is outside your line of sight, then you discern its direction but not its exact location.

The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it.

Disguise Self
Level: Bard 1, Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 minute
Targets: Self
Duration: 10 min/level

You make yourself—including clothing, armor, weapons, and equipment—look different. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller, thin, fat, or in between. You cannot change your body type. Otherwise, the extent of the apparent change is up to you. You could add or obscure a minor feature or look like an entirely different person.

The spell does not provide the abilities or mannerisms of the chosen form, nor does it alter the perceived tactile (touch) or audible (sound) properties of you or your equipment.

If you use this spell to create a disguise, you get a +10 bonus on the Disguise check.

Dispel Magic
Level: Bard 3, Cleric 3, Sorcerer 3, Wizard 3
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Target: 30' cube or one magical object or one spell being cast
Saving Throw: Special

There are 3 forms of dispel magic. Some spells can't be dispelled - in particular curses. Spell description should describe if it needs a different spell to be dispelled.

Area Dispel

In this form, dispel magic affects all creatures and objects in a 30' cube. All spells of 3rd level or lower in the cube immediately end.

Animated creatures and summoned creatures can make a will saving throw to ignore this effect.

Note that this affects all spells, including the spells of the caster and his allies.

Object Suppress

In this form, the magical properties of a single item, device, ward, etc. is suppressed. Roll a caster level check (d20 + caster level) against a DC set by the DM on a per-item basis. This renders the item non-operational for 1d4 rounds.

Counterspell

A spell of 3rd level or lower is automatically countered. Higher level spells require opposed caster level checks.

Displacement
Level: Bard 3, Sorcerer 3, Wizard 3
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 creature touched
Duration: 1 round/level (D)

The subject of this spell appears to be about 2 feet away from its true location. The creature benefits from a 50% miss chance as if it had total concealment.

However, unlike actual total concealment, displacement does not prevent enemies from targeting the creature normally. True seeing reveals its true location.

Disrupt Undead
Level: Sorcerer 0, Wizard 0
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)
Targets: 1 undead creature

You direct a ray of positive energy. You must make a ranged touch attack to hit, and if the ray hits an undead creature, it deals 1d6 points of damage to it.

Distort Speech
Level: Bard 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: Standard Action
Range: Close (25' + 5'/level)
Targets: One Creature
Duration: 1 round/level
Saving Throw: Fortitude Negates

For the duration of this spell, the subject has a 50% chance to miscast spells that have verbal components, and any time the subject speaks, there is a 50% chance that the utterance is completely incomprehensible and therefore ineffective.

Divine Favor
Level: Cleric 1
Components: V,S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: self
Duration: 1 min/level

Calling upon the strength and wisdom of your deity, you gain a +1 sacred bonus on attack and weapon damage rolls for every three caster levels you have (at least +1, maximum +3). The bonus doesn’t apply to spell damage.

Doom
Level: Cleric 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: One living creature
Duration: 1 min/level
Saving Throw: Will negates

You curse an enemy, giving them a -2 sacred penalty to attack rolls, saves and checks.

Eagle's Splendor
Level: Wizard 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 creature touched other than the caster
Duration: 10 min/level

The touched creature charisma score becomes 19. This spell has no effect on those with a charisma higher than this. Enhancement effects do not enhance this score further.

Electric Loop
Level: Sorcerer 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25' + 5'/2 levels)
Targets: One creature
Saving Throw: Reflex half (and Will negates stun)
Tags: Lightning

You create one small stroke of lightning that targets one creature The spell deals 1d6 points of electricity damage per caster levels to the target.

A creature that fails its Reflex save must make a successful Will save or be stunned for 1 round.

Electric Jolt
Level: Sorcerer 0
Components: V,S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25' + 5'/2 levels)
Tags: Lightning

You release a small stroke of electrical energy. You must make a ranged touch attack to deal damage to a target. The spell deals 1d3 points of electricity damage.

Enhance Potion
Level: Wizard 1
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 potion
Duration: 10 min/level

The effect of the potion or alchemical item is doubled. If there is no clear thing to double, the duration is instead doubled. The DM will rule exactly what happens, but for example a potion of healing will heal twice as much.

Enlarge Person
Level: Wizard 1
Components: V, S, M (a pinch of powdered iron)
Casting Time: 1 round
Range: Close (25' + 5'/2 levels)
Targets: 1 man-shaped creature of man-size or smaller
Duration: 1 min/level
Saving Throw: Fortitude Negates

This spell causes instant growth of a humanoid creature, doubling its height and multiplying its weight by 8. This increase changes the creature’s size category to the next larger one. The target gains a -1 penalty on attack rolls and AC due to its increased size.

A humanoid creature whose size increases to Large has a space of 10 feet and a natural reach of 10 feet. This spell does not change the target’s speed.

If insufficient room is available for the desired growth, the spell fails.

All equipment worn or carried by a creature is similarly enlarged by the spell.

Melee weapons affected by this spell deal more damage (see Weapon Size).

Other magical properties are not affected by this spell.

Any enlarged item that leaves an enlarged creature’s possession (including a projectile or thrown weapon) instantly returns to its normal size. This means that thrown weapons deal their normal damage, and projectiles deal damage based on the size of the weapon that fired them.

Magical properties of enlarged items are not increased by this spell.

Multiple magical effects that increase size do not stack,.

Enlarge Toad
Level: Wizard 1
Components: V, S, M (the toad)
Casting Time: 1 round
Range: Touch
Targets: 1 toad
Duration: 1 min/level

The caster enlarges a toad in their hand to become aproximately as large as a person. The toad enters the battle and can act immediately. At the caster's option she may hurl the toad as a grenade-like attack before the magic fully takes effect to a space within 30'.

If the toad takes any damage, it instead turns back into a normal toad.

The toad has 10 AC and a +2 bonus to saves.

The toad will try to grapple an enemy with their tongue each turn.

It has a grapple bonus equal to the caster's level +4.

The tongue allows it to grapple from a range of 15' away, and, if the initial grapple check is successful, pulls the creature adjacent to the toad.

The toad's grapple damage is a mere 1 point of damage.

Entangle
Level: Druid 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100 + 10'/level)
Area: 20' square
Duration: 1 min/level
Saving Throw: Reflex

Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square starting from a point within range. If there are natural plants in the area, instead those plants are altered. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

A creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Reflex saving throw or be entangled and held fast by the entangling plants until the spell ends. Creatures larger than Large are unaffect (terrain is still difficult).

A creature restrained by the plants can use its action to make a DC 15 Strength check or DC 15 escape artist check. On a success, it frees itself.

Note: The effects of the spell may be altered somewhat, based on the nature of the entangling plants.

Entropic Shield
Level: Cleric 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: You
Duration: 1 min/level

A magical field appears around you, glowing with a chaotic blast of multicolored hues. This field deflects incoming arrows, rays, and other ranged attacks.

Each ranged attack directed at you for which the attacker must make an attack roll has a 20% miss chance.

Other attacks that simply work at a distance are not affected.

Enwebben
Level: Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V, S, M (a bit of spider web)
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25'+5'/2 levels)
Targets: 1 medium sized or smaller creature

You shoot a web at a creature. If you succeed on a ranged touch attack, they are entangled (and anchored to the ground). The creature can escape the web by succeeding on a DC 15 strength check or a DC 20 escape artist check. Fire burns away the webs and deals 2d4 damage to the creature. If they escape the web, the web crumbles away. It otherwise lasts forever.

Expeditious Retreat
Level: Bard 1, Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V,S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: You and up to 3 allies/level
Duration: 1 minute

This spell enables you and your allies to travel 30' per round faster, but only away from a battle or confrontation. See the rules for running away. In theater of the mind, this spell effectively let's you and your allies get away from a battle, as long as no one is like in a t-rex's jaws or something.

Explosive Runes
Level: Wizard 3
Components: V, S, M (ruby powder worth 50gp)
Casting Time: 1 minute
Targets: object touched
Duration: Permanent
Saving Throw: Special

You trace these mystic runes upon a book, map, scroll, or similar object bearing written information. The runes detonate when read, dealing 6d6 points of force damage. Anyone next to the runes (close enough to read them) takes the full damage with no saving throw; any other creature within 10 feet of the runes is entitled to a Reflex save for half damage. The object on which the runes were written also takes full damage (no saving throw).

You and any characters you specifically instruct can read the protected writing without triggering the runes. Likewise, you can remove the runes whenever desired. Another creature can remove them with dispel magic.

Faerie Fire
Level: Druid 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Long (400 ft. + 40 ft./level)
Targets: Creatures and objects within a 5-ft.-radius burst
Duration: 1 min/level
Tags: Light

A pale glow surrounds and outlines the subjects. Outlined subjects shed light as candles.

Outlined creatures do not benefit from the concealment normally provided by darkness (though a 2nd-level or higher magical darkness effect functions normally), blur, displacement, invisibility, or similar effects.

The light is too dim to have any special effect on undead or dark-dwelling creatures vulnerable to light.

The faerie fire can be blue, green, or violet, according to your choice at the time of casting. The faerie fire does not cause any harm to the objects or creatures thus outlined.

False Life
Level: Sorcerer 2, Wizard 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Duration: 1 hour/level

You harness the power of unlife to grant yourself a limited ability to avoid death.

While this spell is in effect, you gain temporary hit points equal to 1d10 +1 per caster level.

Feather Fall
Level: Bard 1, Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V
Casting Time: 1 immediate action
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)
Targets: One Medium or smaller freefalling object or creature/level, no two of which may be more than 20 ft. apart
Duration: Until landing or 1 round/level

The affected creatures or objects fall slowly. Feather fall instantly changes the rate at which the targets fall to a mere 60 feet per round (equivalent to the end of a fall from a few feet), and the subjects take no damage upon landing while the spell is in effect. However, when the spell duration expires, a normal rate of falling resumes.

The spell affects one or more Medium or smaller creatures (including gear and carried objects up to each creature’s maximum load) or objects, or the equivalent in larger creatures: A Large creature or object counts as two Medium creatures or objects, a Huge creature or object counts as two Large creatures or objects, and so forth.

You can cast this spell with an instant utterance, quickly enough to save yourself if you unexpectedly fall. Casting the spell is a immediate action, allowing you to cast this spell even when it isn’t your turn.

This spell has no special effect on ranged weapons unless they are falling quite a distance. If the spell is cast on a falling item the object does half normal damage based on its weight, with no bonus for the height of the drop.

Feather fall works only upon free-falling objects. It does not affect a sword blow or a charging or flying creature.

Find Traps
Level: Cleric 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 10 minutes
Range: 30'

You are alerted to the presence and general location of traps within 30' (for example, you learn a door is trapped or a chest is trapped, but not how).

Fire Trap
Level: Druid 2, Wizard 4
Components: V, S, M (25gp of gold dust)
Casting Time: 10 minutes
Duration: Permanent
Saving Throw: Reflex Half

Fire trap creates a fiery explosion when an intruder opens the item that the trap protects. A fire trap can ward any object that can be opened and closed.

When casting fire trap, you select a point on the object as the spell’s center. When someone other than you opens the object, a fiery explosion fills the area within a 5-foot radius around the spell’s center. The flames deal 1d4 points of fire damage +1 point per caster level. The item protected by the trap is not harmed by this explosion. However, it is quite useful to also have a bomb or keg of gunpowder that the firetrap detonates.

A fire trapped item cannot have a second closure or warding spell placed on it.

A knock spell does not bypass a fire trap. An unsuccessful dispel magic spell does not detonate the spell.

Underwater, this ward deals half damage and creates a large cloud of steam.

You can use the fire trapped object without discharging it, as can any individual to whom the object was specifically attuned when cast. Attuning a fire trapped object to an individual usually involves setting a password that you can share with friends.

Fireball
Level: Sorcerer 3, Wizard 3
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Long (400' + 40'/level)
Area: 20' radius spread
Saving Throw: Reflex Half
Tags: Fire

A fireball spell is an explosion of flame that detonates with a low roar and deals 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 10d6) to every creature within the area. Unattended objects also take this damage. The explosion creates almost no pressure.

You point your finger and determine the range (distance and height) at which the fireball is to burst. A glowing, pea-sized bead streaks from the pointing digit and, unless it impacts upon a material body or solid barrier prior to attaining the prescribed range, blossoms into the fireball at that point. (An early impact results in an early detonation.)

If you attempt to send the bead through a narrow passage, such as through an arrow slit, you must “hit” the opening with a ranged touch attack, or else the bead strikes the barrier and detonates prematurely.

At very far distances (over 100 yards), the DM may require a to-hit roll as well.

The fireball sets fire to combustibles (papers, parchment, straw, etc.) and damages objects in the area. It can melt metals with low melting points, such as lead, gold, copper, silver, and bronze, greatly diminishing the value of jewelry.

If the damage caused to an interposing barrier shatters or breaks through it, the fireball may continue beyond the barrier if the area permits; otherwise it stops at the barrier just as any other spell effect does.

Flame Arrow
Level: Sorcerer 3, Wizard 3
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: Arrows or one creature
Tags: Fire

This spell enables the caster to hurl fiery bolts at opponents within range. Each bolt inflicts 1d6 points of piercing damage, plus 4d6 points of fire damage.

The caster can fire 1 such bolt for every two levels of experience they have. He rolls a single ranged touch attack and applies the result against all he targets. He must target a different creature with each arrow.

Flame Blade
Level: Druid 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Duration: 1 min/level

A 3-foot-long, blazing beam of red-hot fire springs forth from your hand.

You wield this bladelike beam as if it were a scimitar. Attacks with the flame blade are melee touch attacks. The blade deals 1d8 points of fire damage +1 point per caster level.

A flame blade can ignite combustible materials such as parchment, straw, dry sticks, and cloth.

The spell does not function underwater.

Flaming Sphere
Level: Druid 2, Sorcerer 2, Wizard 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)
Duration: 1 round/level
Saving Throw: Reflex Negates

A burning globe of fire rolls in whichever direction you point and burns those it strikes.

It moves 30 feet per round. As part of this movement, it can ascend or jump up to 30 feet to strike a target.

If it attempts to enter a space with a creature, it stops moving for the round and deals 2d6 points of fire damage to that creature, though a successful Reflex save negates that damage.

A flaming sphere rolls over barriers less than 4 feet tall.

It ignites flammable substances it touches and illuminates the same area as a torch would.

The sphere moves as long as you actively direct it (a move action for you); otherwise, it merely stays at rest and burns.

It can be extinguished by any means that would put out a normal fire of its size.

The surface of the sphere has a spongy, yielding consistency and so does not cause damage except by its flame. It cannot push aside unwilling creatures or batter down large obstacles. A Giant could kick it like a soccer ball, suffering 2d6 fire damage in the process and propelling it to where he chooses within 30'.

A flaming sphere winks out if it exceeds the spell’s range.

Flare
Level: Bard 0, Sorcerer 0, Wizard 0
Components: V
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Duration: 1 minute
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates
Tags: Light

This cantrip creates a burst of light.

If you cause the light to burst directly in front of a single creature, that creature is dazzled for 1 minute unless it makes a successful Fortitude save.

Sightless creatures, as well as creatures already dazzled, are not affected by flare.

Floating Disk
Level: Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V, S, M (a drop of mercury)
Casting Time: 1 minute
Duration: 10 minutes + 10 minutes / level

You create a slightly concave, circular plane of force that follows you about and carries loads for you.

The disk is 3 feet in diameter and 1 inch deep at its center. It can hold 20 slots worth of gear per caster level (or 100 pounds/level for things measured as such). (If used to transport a liquid, its capacity is 2 gallons.) Baskets or similar might be needed to ensure excess gear does not fall off the disk.

The disk floats approximately 3 feet above the ground at all times and remains level.

It floats along horizontally within spell range and will accompany you at a rate of no more than your normal speed each round.

If not otherwise directed, it maintains a constant interval of 5 feet between itself and you.

The disk winks out of existence when the spell duration expires.

The disk also winks out if you move beyond range or try to take the disk more than 3 feet away from the surface beneath it.

It also winks out if you cast this spell again.

When the disk winks out, whatever it was supporting crashes to the surface beneath it.

Fly

Level: Sorcerer 3, Wizard 3
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 touched creature
Duration: 1 min/level

The subject can fly at a speed of 60 feet.

It can ascend at half speed and descend at double speed, and its maneuverability is good.

Using a fly spell requires only as much concentration as walking, so the subject can attack normally. Spellcasting is impossible.

The subject of a fly spell can charge but not run, and it cannot carry aloft more weight than its maximum load, plus any armor it wears.

Should the spell duration expire while the subject is still aloft, he immediately plummets to the ground.

Fog Cloud
Level: Druid 2, Sorcerer 2, Wizard 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft. level)
Area: 20' radius of fog
Duration: 10 min./level

A bank of fog billows out from the point you designate. The fog obscures all sight, including darkvision, beyond 5 feet. A creature within 5 feet has concealment (attacks have a 20% miss chance). Creatures farther away have total concealment (50% miss chance, and the attacker can’t use sight to locate the target).

A moderate wind (11+ mph) disperses the fog in 4 rounds; a strong wind (21+ mph) disperses the fog in 1 round.

The spell does not function underwater.

Forget
Level: Bard 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: 90'
Targets: up to 4 creatures within 20' of each other
Saving Throw: Will negates

By means of this spell, the spellcaster causes creatures within the area of effect to forget the events of the previous minute + 1 minute per 3 caster levels.

Fox's Cunning
Level: Wizard 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 creature touched other than the caster
Duration: 10 min/level

The touched creature intelligence score becomes 19. This spell has no effect on those with a intelligence higher than this. Enhancement effects do not enhance this score further.

Gaseous Form
Level: Wizard 3
Components: S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 willing touched creature
Duration: 10min/level (D)

The subject and all its gear become insubstantial, misty, and translucent.

Its AC becomes 20.

The subject gains damage reduction 10/- and becomes immune to poison and critical hits.

It can’t attack or cast spells with verbal, somatic, material, or focus components while in gaseous form (so basically nothing).

The subject also loses supernatural abilities while in gaseous form.

If it has a touch spell ready to use, that spell is discharged harmlessly when the gaseous form spell takes effect.

A gaseous creature can’t run, but it can fly at a speed of 10 feet (maneuverability perfect).

It can pass through small holes or narrow openings, even mere cracks, with all it was wearing or holding in its hands, as long as the spell persists.

The creature is subject to the effects of wind, and it can’t enter water or other liquid.

It also can’t manipulate objects or activate items, even those carried along with its gaseous form.

Gentle Repose
Level: Wizard 3
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 minute
Targets: 1 corpse
Duration: 1 day/level

You preserve the remains of a dead creature so that they do not decay.

Ghost Harp
Level: Bard 0
Components: V, S
Casting Time: length of performance
Duration: 5 days / level

Ghost Harp allows you to record a song into an object. You can then set some trigger that will cause the object to play back the song. It will do so every time the song is triggered, but won't restart if it is already playing. The ghost harp's music itself cannot transmit music (no bardic music abilities).

Ghost Sound
Level: Bard 0, Sorcerer 0, Wizard 0
Components: V,S,M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)
Duration: 1 round/level (D)

Ghost sound allows you to create a volume of sound that rises, recedes, approaches, or remains at a fixed place.

You choose what type of sound ghost sound creates when casting it and cannot thereafter change the sound’s basic character.

You must create some general kind of sound, like a group of people moaning, talking, singing, shouting walking, marching, running, etc. The nature of the sound is fixed upon casting and cannot react to situations. If you make people talk, attentive listening will reveal it to be gibberish.

The volume of sound created depends on your level. You can produce as much noise as four normal humans per caster level (maximum twenty humans).

The noise a ghost sound spell produces can be virtually any type of sound within the volume limit.

A horde of rats running and squeaking is about the same volume as eight humans running and shouting.

A roaring lion is equal to the noise from sixteen humans, while a roaring dire tiger is equal to the noise from twenty humans.

Ghoul Touch
Level: Sorcerer 2, Wizard 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Duration: 1d6+2 rounds
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates

Imbuing you with negative energy, this spell allows you to paralyze a single living humanoid for the duration of the spell with a successful melee touch attack. Upon casting this spell you can delive the touch attack as a free action. If you miss, you can try again on subsequent rounds or until 10 minutes passes.

Additionally, the paralyzed subject exudes a carrion stench that causes all living creatures (except you) in a 10-foot-radius spread to become sickened (Fortitude negates). A neutralize poison spell removes the effect from a sickened creature, and creatures immune to poison are unaffected by the stench.

Glitterdust
Level: Bard 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Area: 10' radius spread
Duration: 1 round/level
Saving Throw: Fortitude Negates

A cloud of golden particles covers everyone and everything in the area, causing creatures to become blinded and visibly outlining invisible things for the duration of the spell.

All within the area are covered by the dust, which cannot be removed and continues to sparkle until it fades.

Any creature covered by the dust takes a -40 penalty on Hide checks.

Goodberry
Level: Druid 1
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Duration: one day/level (max 7 days).

Casting goodberry upon a handful of freshly picked berries makes 8 + 1/level of them magical.

You (as well as any other druid of 3rd or higher level) can immediately discern which berries are affected.

The berry also cures 1 point of damage when eaten.

Grease
Level: Bard 1, Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V, S, M (a bit of pork rind or butter)
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)
Targets: One object or a 10-ft. square
Duration: 1rd / level (D)
Saving Throw: Reflex

A grease spell covers a solid surface with a layer of slippery grease. Any creature in the area when the spell is cast must make a successful Reflex save or fall.

A creature that enters the grease must also make a succesful reflex save or fall, sliding through the grease to the other side and ending their movement there prone (or farther away if they are charging, the grease is on a slide, etc.).

Any creature who is standing at the beginning of your turn each round must save again or fall prone in the grease.

The spell can alternatively be used to create a greasy coating on an item. Material objects not in use are always affected by this spell, while an object wielded or employed by a creature allows the creature to make a Reflex saving throw to avoid the effect.

If the initial saving throw fails, the creature immediately drops the item.

A saving throw must be made in each round that the creature attempts to pick up or use the greased item.

A creature wearing greased armor or clothing gains a +10 circumstance bonus on Escape Artist checks and on grapple checks made to resist or escape a grapple or to escape a pin.

Guiding Light
Level: Bard 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Long (400' + 40'/level)
Targets: Creatures in a 10' square
Duration: 1 minute/level
Tags: Light

Bright lights shine at the targets. The light grants ranged attackers a +2 bonus against those creatures. The light sticks to the creatures and makes it impossible for them to benefit from less than total concealment.

Gust of Wind
Level: Druid 2, Sorcerer 2, Wizard 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Area: 60' line of air
Duration: 1rd/level
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates

This spell creates a severe blast of air (approximately 50 mph) that originates from you, affecting all creatures in its path.

A Tiny or smaller creature on the ground is knocked down and rolled 1d4×10 feet, taking 1d4 points of nonlethal damage per 10 feet. If flying, a Tiny or smaller creature is blown back 2d6×10 feet and takes 2d6 points of nonlethal damage due to battering and buffeting.

Small creatures are knocked prone by the force of the wind, or if flying are blown back 1d6×10 feet.

Medium creatures are unable to move forward against the force of the wind, or if flying are blown back 1d6×5 feet.

Large or larger creatures may move normally within a gust of wind effect.

A gust of wind can’t move a creature beyond the limit of its range.

Any creature, regardless of size, takes a -4 penalty on ranged attacks and Listen checks in the area of a gust of wind.

The force of the gust automatically extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50% chance to extinguish those lights.

In addition to the effects noted, a gust of wind can do anything that a sudden blast of wind would be expected to do. It can create a stinging spray of sand or dust, fan a large fire, overturn delicate awnings or hangings, heel over a small boat, and blow gases or vapors to the edge of its range.

Halt Undead
Level: Wizard 3
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)
Targets: Up to three undead creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Duration: 1 round/level
Saving Throw: Will negates

This spell renders as many as three undead creatures immobile. A nonintelligent undead creature gets no saving throw; an intelligent undead creature does.

If the spell is successful, it renders the undead creature immobile for the duration of the spell (unable to move or attack).

The effect is broken if the halted creatures are attacked or take damage.

Haste
Level: Bard 3, Sorcerer 3, Wizard 3
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25' + 5'/2 levels)
Targets: 1 creature/level, no two of which are more than 30' apart
Duration: 3 rounds

Creatures affected by this spell act more quickly. Creatures affected by this spell have their movement rates doubled. Additionally, when they attack they can attack once more (at their highest base attack bonus).

Haste dispels slow, negating both spells.

Hide from Animals
Level: Druid 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: touch
Targets: One touched creature/level
Duration: 10 min/level

Animals cannot see, hear, or smell the warded creatures. Even extraordinary or supernatural sensory capabilities, such as blindsense, blindsight, scent, and tremorsense, cannot detect or locate warded creatures.

Animal creatures are automatically affected and act as though the warded creatures are not there.

If a warded creature casts a spell near an animal, attempts to turn or command an animal, touches an animal creature, or attacks any creature, the spell ends for all recipients.

Hide from Undead
Level: Cleric 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: touch
Targets: One touched creature/level
Duration: 10 min/level

Undead cannot see, hear, or smell the warded creatures. Even extraordinary or supernatural sensory capabilities, such as blindsense, blindsight, scent, and tremorsense, cannot detect or locate warded creatures.

Nonintelligent undead creatures are automatically affected and act as though the warded creatures are not there.

An intelligent undead creature gets a single Will saving throw. If it fails, the subject can’t see any of the warded creatures. However, if it has reason to believe unseen opponents are present, it can attempt to find or strike them.

If a warded creature attempts to turn or command undead, touches an undead creature, or attacks any creature, the spell ends for all recipients.

Hideous Laughter
Level: Bard 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25' + 5'/2 levels)
Targets: One creature with a sense of humor
Duration: 1 round / level
Saving Throw: Will negates

This spell afflicts the subject with uncontrollable laughter. It collapses into gales of manic laughter, falling prone. The subject can take no actions while laughing, but is not considered helpless. After the spell ends, it can act normally.

A creature without a sense of humor (like a slime) cannot be affected by this spell.

A creature who isn't humaoid receives a +4 bonus on its saving throw, because humor doesn’t “translate” well.

Hold Animal
Level: Druid 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: one animal
Duration: 1 round/level (D)
Saving Throw: Will negates

The subject becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cannot take any actions, even speech.

Each round on its turn, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect. (This is a full-round action that does not provoke attacks of opportunity.)

A winged creature who is paralyzed cannot flap its wings and falls. A swimmer can’t swim and will drown.

Hold Person
Level: Bard 2, Cleric 2, Sorcerer 3, Wizard 3
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: one man-shaped, man-sized or smaller creature
Duration: 1 round/level (D)
Saving Throw: Will negates

The subject becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cannot take any actions, even speech.

Each round on its turn, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect. (This is a full-round action that does not provoke attacks of opportunity.)

A winged creature who is paralyzed cannot flap its wings and falls. A swimmer can’t swim and will drown.

Hold Portal
Level: Wizard 1
Components: V
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)
Targets: 1 door or portal
Duration: 1 min./level (D)

This spell magically holds shut a door, gate, window, or shutter of wood, metal, or stone. The magic affects the portal just as if it were securely closed and normally locked. A knock spell or a successful dispel magic spell can negate a hold portal spell.

For a portal affected by this spell, add 10 to the normal DC for forcing open the portal.

Hypnotic Pattern
Level: Bard 2, Sorcerer 2, Wizard 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)
Area: 10' radius spread
Duration: Concentration + 2 rounds
Saving Throw: Will negates

A twisting pattern of subtle, shifting colors weaves through the air, fascinating creatures within it.

Roll 2d4 and add your caster level (maximum 10) to determine the total number of Hit Dice of creatures affected.

Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first; and, among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the spell’s point of origin are affected first.

Hit Dice that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.

Affected creatures become fascinated by the pattern of colors. Sightless creatures are not affected.

Hypnotism
Level: Bard 1, Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 swift action
Range: Close (25' + 5'/2 levels)
Duration: 2d4 rounds
Saving Throw: Will negates
Tags: Mind affecting

This spell does not work in combat.

The gestures of the wizard, along with his droning incantation, cause 1d6 creatures within the area to become susceptible to a suggestion--a brief and reasonable-sounding request.

The request must be given after the hypnotism spell is cast. Until that time, the success of the spell is unknown.

Note that the subsequent suggestion is not a spell, but simply a vocalized urging (the caster must speak a language the creature understands for this spell to work).

Creatures that successfully roll their saving throws are not under hypnotic influence. Those who are exceptionally wary or hostile save with +1 to +3 bonuses. If the spell is cast at an individual creature that meets the caster's gaze, the saving throw is made with a penalty of -2.

A creature that fails its saving throw does not remember that the caster enspelled it.

Identify
Level: Bard 1, Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V, S, M (100gp pearl powdered into wine, with an owl feather which is then drunk)
Casting Time: 1 hour

The spell determines all magic properties of a single magic item, including how to activate those functions (if appropriate), and how many charges are left (if any).

To identify an item, the caster must handle the item and more or less use it as it is intended (a helmet must be worn, a sword swung, a wand pointed and pseudo activated, a potion sipped, etc.). Thus, if the item is cursed, the caster will suffer the consequences.

Illusory Script
Level: Wizard 3
Components: V, S, M (special ink worth 50gp)
Casting Time: 1 minute or longer
Duration: 1 day/level

You write instructions or other information on parchment, paper, or any suitable writing material. The illusory script appears to be some form of foreign or magical writing. Only the person (or people) designated by you at the time of the casting are able to read the writing; it’s unintelligible to any other character, although an illusionist recognizes it as illusory script.

Any unauthorized creature attempting to read the script triggers a potent illusory effect and must make a saving throw. A successful saving throw means the creature can look away with only a mild sense of disorientation. Failure means the creature is subject to a suggestion implanted in the script by you at the time the illusory script spell was cast. The suggestion lasts only 30 minutes. Typical suggestions include “Close the book and leave,” “Forget the existence of the book,” and so forth. If successfully dispelled by dispel magic, the illusory script and its secret message disappear. The hidden message can be read by a combination of the true seeing spell with the read magic or comprehend languages spell.

The casting time depends on how long a message you wish to write, but it is always at least 1 minute.

Inflict Critical Wounds
Level: Cleric 4
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: touch

You lay your hand on a creature (melee touch attack), channel negative energy and wound them for 4d8+1/level (max + 20) hit points of damage.

When you cast this spell, it grants you a free action to deliver the touch attack.

If you miss, you can try again as a standard action.

Inflict Light Wounds
Level: Cleric 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: touch

You lay your hand on a creature (melee touch attack), channel negative energy and wound them for 1d8+1/level (max + 5) hit points of damage.

When you cast this spell, it grants you a free action to deliver the touch attack.

If you miss, you can try again as a standard action.

Inflict Moderate Wounds
Level: Cleric 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: touch

You lay your hand on a creature (melee touch attack), channel negative energy and wound them for 2d8+1/level (max + 10) hit points of damage.

When you cast this spell, it grants you a free action to deliver the touch attack.

If you miss, you can try again as a standard action.

Inflict Serious Wounds
Level: Cleric 3
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: touch

You lay your hand on a creature (melee touch attack), channel negative energy and wound them for 3d8+1/level (max + 15) hit points of damage.

When you cast this spell, it grants you a free action to deliver the touch attack.

If you miss, you can try again as a standard action.

Inspirational Boost
Level: Bard 0
Components: V
Casting Time: 1 swift action
Duration: 1 minute or until you use a bardic music

All numeric effects of your next bardic music is 1 better. For example, your inspire courage adds an extra +1 to saving throws against charm and fear, an extra +1 to attack and an extra +1 to damage.

Invisibility 10' Radius
Level: Bard 3, Sorcerer 3, Wizard 3
Components: V,S,M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: 10' radius
Duration: 1 min/level.

This spell functions like invisibility, except that this spell confers invisibility upon all creatures within 10 feet of the recipient. The center of the effect is mobile with the recipient.

Those affected by this spell can see each other and themselves as if unaffected by the spell. Any affected creature moving out of the area becomes visible, but creatures moving into the area after the spell is cast do not become invisible. Affected creatures (other than the recipient) who attack negate the invisibility only for themselves. If the spell recipient attacks, the invisibility ends.

Invisibility
Level: Bard 2, Sorcerer 2, Wizard 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 creature touched or an object weighing 100lb/level or less
Duration: 1 min/level (D)

The creature or object touched becomes invisible, vanishing from sight, even from darkvision. If the recipient is a creature carrying gear, that vanishes, too.

If you cast the spell on someone else, neither you nor your allies can see the subject, unless you can normally see invisible things or you employ magic to do so.

Items dropped or put down by an invisible creature become visible; items picked up disappear if tucked into the clothing or pouches worn by the creature.

Light, however, never becomes invisible, although a source of light can become so (thus, the effect is that of a light with no visible source). Any part of an item that the subject carries but that extends more than 10 feet from it becomes visible.

Of course, the subject is not magically silenced, and certain other conditions can render the recipient detectable (such as stepping in a puddle).

The spell ends if the subject attacks any creature or casts a spell.

Jump
Level: Druid 1, Sorcerer 1, Wizard 1
Components: V, S, M (grasshopper's hind leg)
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: touch
Duration: 1 min/level (D)

The individual touched when this spell is cast is empowered to leap once per round as a free action for the duration of the spell.

Leaps can be up to 30 feet forward or straight upward or 10 feet backward. Horizontal leaps forward or backward have only a slight arc--about 2 feet per 10 feet of distance traveled. The jump spell does not ensure safety in landing or grasping at the end of the leap.

Knock
Level: Sorcerer 2, Wizard 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 10 minutes

Upon casting this spell, a very loud "knock" sound can be heard and barriers to entry are undone. This noise is certainly loud enough to attract the attention of anyone who happened to be wandering by.

The knock spell opens stuck, barred, locked, held, or arcane locked doors.

It opens secret doors, as well as locked or trick-opening boxes or chests.

It also loosens welds, shackles, or chains (provided they serve to hold closures shut).

If used to open a arcane locked door, the spell does not remove the arcane lock but simply suspends its functioning for 10 minutes.

In all other cases, the door does not relock itself or become stuck again on its own.

Knock does not raise barred gates or similar impediments (such as a portcullis), nor does it affect ropes, vines, and the like.

Each spell can undo as many as two means of preventing egress.

Know Direction
Level: Druid 0
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 minute

You instantly know the direction of north from your current position.

Lesser Confusion
Level: Bard 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Close (25' + 5/ 2levels)
Targets: One living creature
Duration: 1 round
Saving Throw: Will negates

This spell causes the targets to become confused, making them unable to independently determine what they will do.

Roll on the following table at the beginning of each subject’s turn each round to see what the subject does in that round.

d% Behavior
01-10 Attack caster with melee or ranged weapons (or close with caster if attack is not possible).
11-20 Act normally.
21-50 Do nothing but babble incoherently.
51-70 Flee away from caster at top possible speed.
71-100 Attack nearest creature (for this purpose, a familiar counts as part of the subject’s self).

A confused character who can’t carry out the indicated action does nothing but babble incoherently.

Attackers are not at any special advantage when attacking a confused character.

Any confused character who is attacked automatically attacks its attackers on its next turn, as long as it is still confused when its turn comes.

Note that a confused character will not make attacks of opportunity against any creature that it is not already devoted to attacking (either because of its most recent action or because it has just been attacked).

Lesser Elemental Orb
Level: Sorcerer 1
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium (100' + 10'/level)
Targets: 1 creature

Choose a type of orb: cold (water), fire (fire), bludgeoning (earth) or slashing (wind).

You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit your target. The orb deals 1d8 + 1d8/ 2 levels damage of the chosen type.

Lesser Restoration
Level: Cleric 2, Druid 2
Components: V, S
Casting Time: 3 rounds
Targets: Touched creature

Lesser restoration dispels any magical effects reducing one of the subject’s ability scores or cures 1d4 points of temporary ability damage to one of the subject’s ability scores.

It also eliminates any fatigue suffered by the character, and improves an exhausted condition to fatigued.

It does not restore permanent ability drain.

Levitate
Level: Wizard 2
Components: V, S, M
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Targets: 1 willing creature touched
Duration: 1 min/level
